programme.title: Flavours of Venice - Episode 3
programme.desc: We have approached the end of the series, and in this final episode Andi will be experiencing the art of glass blowing on the island of Murano. Then, she will enjoy a vegan meal prepared on board that has been paired with coffee instead of wine. Let's dive into the flavours of Venice!

programme.title: Moana Waiwai
programme.desc: Moana Waiwai follows the Free Swim journey of wahine (woman) Ally Davey as she takes on 70km of open ocean around the stunning Coromandel coastline to bring awareness to the protection of New Zealand’s oceans.For over three days it does more than encapsulate stunning panoramas on the extraordinary scenario of New Zealand. It is also inspiring for people as we become aware of the natural beauty of the ocean so we can protect it before it is too late.This is an inspirational film, not an activist propaganda, that highlights exploration and the intrinsic benefits of getting wet and looking below the surface. In Moana Waiwai Ally Davey will champion endurance of her human spirit in this seemingly impossible task to achieve a higher goal: protection of the oceans.Be part of her adventure on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Episode 3bis Freestyle Olbia, ITALY
programme.desc: The UIM-ABP Aquabike World Championship has returned to the beautiful Olbia in the northeastern coast of Sardinia. Notoriously rough water conditions await as round two of the 2019 season will be raced at the Grand Prix of Italy. 150 riders from 30 countries raced in the different categories. We will be focusing on the Runabout and Freestyle divisions.Come join us in one of the most scenic and gorgeous corners of the Mediterranean island of Sardinia for the best aquabike action.

programme.title: Surf Series: South Africa - Episode 1 - Nelson Mandela Pro
programme.desc: The first event of the South African WQS during series kicks off in Nelson Mandela Bay. Challenging conditions make it even tougher for surfers to get the vital points they need to advance. Will they have what it takes to raise to the top? Don’t miss all the action, the disappointments and victories at the start of what will be an epic African series.

programme.title: Surf Series: South Africa - Episode 2 - Port Alfred Classic
programme.desc: Welcome to the second event of the South Africa WQS Surf Series. This time, we are in Port Alfred at The Royal St Andrews Hotel Port Alfred Classic. Some of South Africa's best waves can be surfed here despite also being one of the most underrated locations. We are in for a thrill!

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 5
programme.desc: On this week's episode we have comedian and viral video sensation, Megan Mackay. She is best known for her comedic YouTube makeup tutorial videos, and her videos have been seen by more than 4.5 million people worldwide. Will she have the skills to jump on our paddleboard and take on our challenges?

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 6
programme.desc: Welcome to What SUP! On this week's episode we have the proclaimed Canadian singer-songwriter Royal Wood. This band has been nominated for their Juno song as songwriter of the year by iTunes in 2008, and his music has been featured in shows slike Greys Anatomy or Private Practice. But, singing won't save them from our paddleboard challenges, is he ready?

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 1
programme.desc: The time has come for athletes to leave Sables d'Olonne and embark in the journey of their lives. This solo journey will have them push their limits to attempt the extraordinary: circumnavigate around the globe. The boats cross the starting line, but one faces a penalty of 5 hours for leaving early. Find out more about their journey and weekly advances, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 2
programme.desc: We continue our journey in the Vendée Globe. One of the sailors had to return to Sables d'Olonne as his ship encountered some technical issues while the rest of the athletes continue the regatta. They will face their first tropical storm and fight to remain on route in one of the hardest competitions of the world.

programme.title: International Rafting Federation World Championship - Episode 1
programme.desc: International Rafting Federation World Championship - Episode 1

programme.title: Inside Sailing - Episode 1
programme.desc: Inside Sailing - Episode 1

programme.title: Skeleton Sea
programme.desc: João and Xandi, two surfers in their early 50′s, have been working together for 25 years. They clean beaches and with the trash they pick they create the most stunning artwork. However, living as an artist and idealist in Portugal is not economically profitable and, therefore, not easy.Their family life is affected by the choices they make and their wish to raise awareness about the ever-growing pollution in our oceans. Skeleton Sea takes us on their personal journey to help people understand the importance of our oceans to help us take the step to change our habits to keep them clean. As all live comes from the sea, Skeleton Sea reminds us that this powerful force has the ability of taking it away from us as well.

programme.title: Stockholm Archipelago Raid
programme.desc: The Stockholm Archipelago Raid is for participants a unique orienteering race in Europe as it offers a mix of sport, nature and adventure to athletes. This archipelago is the largest in Europe, with 36,000 rocks, skerries and islands, as well as one of the most difficult for navigation. There are still islands and groups of islands where no sail race has ever passed due to their remote location or because they are bird or seal protection areas.Experienced sailors from all over the world gather in the heart of Sweden as it hosts the first F18 Raid World ever. Winners will be crowned as the best long distance F18 raid sailors in the world, marking history in this nautical sport.Watch the Stockholm Archipelago Raid on Nautical Channel and discover the limitless possibilities of this Raid for brave competitors that will race in these remote islands.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 3
programme.desc: Kite Masters - Episode 3

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 4
programme.desc: Right after Weifang, some of the world's top riders flew to Pingtan for the 2017 IKA TwinTip World Championship, together with 2017 KiteFoil GoldCup - ACT3... and so did Kite Masters. Pingtan is the place where it all started for Kiteboarding in China. The first Kiteboarding School was established in Pingtan's sandy beach, helping develop the sport in every way. Since then, thousands of new riders have joined this exciting sport in China.

programme.title: Discovering Halki
programme.desc: In the south-eastern corner of the Aegean, west of Rhodes, there is a cosy island, a truly untouched gem of the Dodecanese. It’s a realm of rock and absolute peace; an island with great nautical tradition and proud islanders with an innate warmth.If you are looking for a hidden paradise on earth, then you have found the right place. Greece is home to a small island called Halki. Majestic and mystical; ethereal; elegant yet unpolished; and truly authentic.In this episode, we will visit Halki’s capital, Emborio and we will explore, with captain George, all the natural hidden treasures of the island.We are set to discover deep caves, bask on Trahia and Kania beach, and explore Alimia islet. We will visit an abandoned village, learning more about its rich history, and scuba dive down to the sea floor to get closer to a legendary shipwreck.Still untouched by mass tourism, Halki is the perfect destination for relaxing holidays away from the bright lights or for a quick getaway from the island of Rhodes. Watch Discovering Halki to become part of this almost untouched territory that is worth visiting.

programme.title: Brilliant Corners Jamaica
programme.desc: The Caribbean is filled with places where tourism is rare or close to non-existent. However, there is so much potential for cultural and water sports tourism, they are called Brilliant corners. Nautical Channel is on a mission to explore the brilliant corners of the Caribbean.Going from Haiti all the way to Jamaica or Barbados, we will dive into these brilliant corners, many of them with no tourism at all. With a sustainable tourism approach, get ready to live a fully local experience on Brilliant Corners Jamaica while we practice water sports, taste the traditional local dishes and talk with the habitants of the area.On this occasion, we venture into Jamaica: the third-largest island of the Greater Antilles and Caribbean, home to famous personalities like Bob Marley or Usain Bolt. Through extreme surf travel and consequent writing and aestheticized by jazz, Sam Bleakley gives a voice to the brilliant corners of this country, revealing the character of the place by getting inside the mind of a coastline as much as people.Immerse yourself in the beauty of the yet to discover areas of the Caribbean, available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Flavours of Venice - Episode 3
programme.desc: We have approached the end of the series, and in this final episode Andi will be experiencing the art of glass blowing on the island of Murano. Then, she will enjoy a vegan meal prepared on board that has been paired with coffee instead of wine. Let's dive into the flavours of Venice!

programme.title: Moana Waiwai
programme.desc: Moana Waiwai follows the Free Swim journey of wahine (woman) Ally Davey as she takes on 70km of open ocean around the stunning Coromandel coastline to bring awareness to the protection of New Zealand’s oceans.For over three days it does more than encapsulate stunning panoramas on the extraordinary scenario of New Zealand. It is also inspiring for people as we become aware of the natural beauty of the ocean so we can protect it before it is too late.This is an inspirational film, not an activist propaganda, that highlights exploration and the intrinsic benefits of getting wet and looking below the surface. In Moana Waiwai Ally Davey will champion endurance of her human spirit in this seemingly impossible task to achieve a higher goal: protection of the oceans.Be part of her adventure on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: RKJ Sailing Legend
programme.desc: Born in Putney, London, Sir William Robert Patrick Knox-Johnston served in the Merchant Navy, where he acquired his skills to later on become a British legend and be awarded the title of Sir.RKJ Sailing Legend is a 56-minute documentary about possibly the most famous sailor in modern times, Sir Robin Knox-Johnston. RKJ was the first man to sail non-stop and alone around the world back in 1969: Now on the 50th anniversary of his achievement, we want to rememorate his feat.Get on board RKJ Sailing Legend, the remarkable story of Knox-Johnston's voyage around the world and into history. Available on Nautical Channel.

RKJ was the first man to sail non-stop and alone around the world back in 1969: Now on the 50th anniversary of his achievement, we want to rememorate his feat.Get on board RKJ Sailing Legend, the remarkable story of Knox-Johnston's voyage around the world and into history. Available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Season Review - Ski Division & Ski Ladies
programme.desc: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Season Review - Ski Division & Ski Ladies

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Episode 3bis Freestyle Olbia, ITALY
programme.desc: The UIM-ABP Aquabike World Championship has returned to the beautiful Olbia in the northeastern coast of Sardinia. Notoriously rough water conditions await as round two of the 2019 season will be raced at the Grand Prix of Italy. 150 riders from 30 countries raced in the different categories. We will be focusing on the Runabout and Freestyle divisions.Come join us in one of the most scenic and gorgeous corners of the Mediterranean island of Sardinia for the best aquabike action.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 3
programme.desc: Kite Masters - Episode 3

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 4
programme.desc: Right after Weifang, some of the world's top riders flew to Pingtan for the 2017 IKA TwinTip World Championship, together with 2017 KiteFoil GoldCup - ACT3... and so did Kite Masters. Pingtan is the place where it all started for Kiteboarding in China. The first Kiteboarding School was established in Pingtan's sandy beach, helping develop the sport in every way. Since then, thousands of new riders have joined this exciting sport in China.

programme.title: International Rafting Federation World Championship - Episode 1
programme.desc: International Rafting Federation World Championship - Episode 1

programme.title: Discovering Halki
programme.desc: In the south-eastern corner of the Aegean, west of Rhodes, there is a cosy island, a truly untouched gem of the Dodecanese. It’s a realm of rock and absolute peace; an island with great nautical tradition and proud islanders with an innate warmth.If you are looking for a hidden paradise on earth, then you have found the right place. Greece is home to a small island called Halki. Majestic and mystical; ethereal; elegant yet unpolished; and truly authentic.In this episode, we will visit Halki’s capital, Emborio and we will explore, with captain George, all the natural hidden treasures of the island.We are set to discover deep caves, bask on Trahia and Kania beach, and explore Alimia islet. We will visit an abandoned village, learning more about its rich history, and scuba dive down to the sea floor to get closer to a legendary shipwreck.Still untouched by mass tourism, Halki is the perfect destination for relaxing holidays away from the bright lights or for a quick getaway from the island of Rhodes. Watch Discovering Halki to become part of this almost untouched territory that is worth visiting.

programme.title: Brilliant Corners Jamaica
programme.desc: The Caribbean is filled with places where tourism is rare or close to non-existent. However, there is so much potential for cultural and water sports tourism, they are called Brilliant corners. Nautical Channel is on a mission to explore the brilliant corners of the Caribbean.Going from Haiti all the way to Jamaica or Barbados, we will dive into these brilliant corners, many of them with no tourism at all. With a sustainable tourism approach, get ready to live a fully local experience on Brilliant Corners Jamaica while we practice water sports, taste the traditional local dishes and talk with the habitants of the area.On this occasion, we venture into Jamaica: the third-largest island of the Greater Antilles and Caribbean, home to famous personalities like Bob Marley or Usain Bolt. Through extreme surf travel and consequent writing and aestheticized by jazz, Sam Bleakley gives a voice to the brilliant corners of this country, revealing the character of the place by getting inside the mind of a coastline as much as people.Immerse yourself in the beauty of the yet to discover areas of the Caribbean, available on Nautical Channel.

programme.desc: Tour de France a' la voile is an annual yachting race around the coast of France. Inaugurated in 1978, it links the English Channel to the French Riviera and is held in July.

programme.title: Sail-Ho - Episode 8
programme.desc: The Crikvenica Riviera is one of the most scenic parts of the Adriatic coast with a rich diversity of attractive beaches, green hinterland, a continental wooden area, a climate that provides perfect refreshment in the summer time and just the right amount of action-packed fun in the sun. Find out more in this episode of Sail-ho Croatia!

programme.title: Sail-Ho - Episode 9
programme.desc: Welcome, sailors! In this episode of Sail-ho Croatia we arrive to the incredibly beautiful, fragrant and action-packed island of Cres. The islands of Cres and Lošinj are connected to the ancient legend of Jason and the Argonauts in their search for the golden fleece aboard the Argo. Stick around to find out the best spots in these islands!

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 1
programme.desc: Andi is on a mission to discover the Tana River, Kenya’s longest river with a unique rapids system. In order to truly experience this region of the Tana, Andi has to learn to navigate the waters on a kayak. She tracks down river expert and professional Kayaker Kris Collyer and challenges him to learn his skill in three days. Andi is tested when she almost drowns trying to complete her mission.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode, Andi will discover the diverse marine ecosystem of Kilifi Creek. She will learn how to sail in three days in order to truly experience the creek. Andi goes 3 degrees south to meet Kevin, a local sailor who patiently teaches Andi the skills she needs in this short span of time. A true local experience is waiting if she can complete her training but failure is always lurking.

programme.title: Maxiboat TV Show - Episode 1
programme.desc: For this first episode of Maxiboat, we focus on two original motorboats: the Foiler from the Enata shipyard (UAE), which flies on the sea thanks to foils, and the Tringaboat, an incredible French powerboat that can go on the road. Also in the summary, a test of the brand new Jeanneau 60 sailboat, an interview with the world tennis star Rafael Nadal aboard his Sunreef 80 motor yacht in Mallorca and a report on Bali catamarans shipyard.

programme.title: Maxiboat TV Show - Episode 2
programme.desc: For this second episode of Maxiboat, we will discover a new French shipyard specialized in eco-responsible sailing catamarans: Windelo catamaran. Also, we will be updated on the construction of the Ultim racing multihulls, the giants of the seas that will participate in the next offshore races. Also on the agenda, sea trials on the BWA and Marshall range of rib boats.

programme.title: Escape to Zanzibar - Episode 1
programme.desc: As soon as we arrive on the island, we begin to explore Zanzibar starting in the northern part of the country. Nungwi, our chosen location is a common touristic destination and its guests are famously welcoming. Let's begin our journey by visiting the famous sea turtle conservation and protection center. Buckle up for this adventure!

programme.title: Escape to Zanzibar - Episode 2
programme.desc: We begin this day of discoveries with a visit to the most important historical landmarks in Stone Town. For lunch, we head straight on to The Rock: one of Zanzibar's greatest icons. The restaurant was literally built on a rock and can only be reached on foot during the low tide. Then, we will follow Shabed's suggestion and dive into the water to try all the activities available.

programme.title: What the Sea Gives me
programme.desc: What The Sea Gives Me is a feature length documentary comprised of intimate & candid interviews with some of the ocean’s most extraordinary ambassadors including Great White shark researcher Brett McBride, artist Matt Beard, photographer Chris Burkard, bodysurfer Angie Oschmann, conservationist Jean-Michelle Cousteau, free-diver Herbert Nitsch. We give you an honest and personal look through the eyes of those who thrive under the most extreme water conditions, those ensuring the proper care of the oceans for future generations and those who simply derive a sense of pure joy from the sea.

programme.title: Escape to Zanzibar - Episode 1

programme.title: La Transat AG2R La Mondiale - Episode 1 - Depart
programme.desc: Every two years, the city of Concarneau in southern Finistère hosts the start of the Transat AG2R La Mondiale: the double-handed transatlantic on identical boats, founded over 25 years ago. This time, 15 boats line up on the quay of Carnot to make legend in this incredible competition. Let's dive into the action in France!

programme.title: La Transat AG2R La Mondiale - Episode 2 - Arrival
programme.desc: 15 crews set off for the world's toughest double-handed transatlantic race, the 7000km Transat AG2R La Mondiale to Saint-Barthélemy in the Caribbean. Ready to push their Figaro Bénéteaus 200% to collect the prize in Port of Gustavia, the battle is about to get intense. Watch the best moments as the boats crossed the finish line in the dreamy Caribbean island!

programme.title: Route du Rhum - Episode 1 - Review
programme.desc: Route du Rhum - Episode 1 - Review

programme.title: Ciuri Ciuri
programme.desc: Sicily, the largest Mediterranean island and just off the “toe” of Italy’s “boot” is the destination chosen this time by our Nautical Hosts Andi and Chelsey as they head to the South of Italy to meet up with renowned Sicilian sailors.Its rich history is not only reflected in their cuisine and culture, but also on their sailing techniques that balance tradition with modern skills. They will discover the coastlines near Palermo to learn how to tack and jibe and of course will try the delicious Sicilian cuisine.Join Andi and Chelsey on their journey around Sicily learning about sailing and tasting traditional dishes in Ciuri Ciuri, exclusive on Nautical Channel.

programme.desc: Tour de France a' la voile is an annual yachting race around the coast of France. Inaugurated in 1978, it links the English Channel to the French Riviera and is held in July.

programme.title: Skagerrak
programme.desc: SKAGERRAK follows the preparation and mental development of the Danish professional stand up paddle athlete Casper Steinfath in his attempt to be the first person in the world to paddle from Denmark to Norway.In his journey, brotherhood and friendship come to play an essential part making a dream and project like the crossing of an entire ocean come true. SKAGERRAK will take you behind the scenes of mainstream media and portrays the Northern and secluded region of Denmark called Thy, where Casper grew up.A region, where a pioneer spirit and desire for independence prevails despite adversity and isolation. SKAGERRAK is an inspirational story that touches upon the dreams, aspirations, and desires that live inside all of us. A film about the courage to reach for the horizon.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 5
programme.desc: First stop for this episode is the exotic destination and kiteboarding playground of Mauritius, for one of the most high-profile and biggest kite-foiling events: the Hydrofoil Pro Tour. From one island to another, we leave the exotic racetracks of Mauritius and head to Cagliari on Sardinia for another exciting gathering of the world's best kitefoiling riders. The World Championship also marked the close of the 2017 Kitefoil Gold Cup World Series.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 6
programme.desc: In this episode, we move to Dongshan, China for the 2017 Dongshan China International Kiteboarding Open. Combining culture with heritage, this small island, located along the Taiwan Strait, hosts a population of 200,000. The Youth Olympic Games is a hot topic in the Kiteboarding community, eagerly anticipated by riders and supporters. Reflecting an exciting and new race format, the slalom/boarder-cross is designed to challenge the riders' ability to stay in control, while maintaining maximum speed.

From one island to another, we leave the exotic racetracks of Mauritius and head to Cagliari on Sardinia for another exciting gathering of the world's best kitefoiling riders. The World Championship also marked the close of the 2017 Kitefoil Gold Cup World Series.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 6
programme.desc: In this episode, we move to Dongshan, China for the 2017 Dongshan China International Kiteboarding Open. Combining culture with heritage, this small island, located along the Taiwan Strait, hosts a population of 200,000. The Youth Olympic Games is a hot topic in the Kiteboarding community, eagerly anticipated by riders and supporters. Reflecting an exciting and new race format, the slalom/boarder-cross is designed to challenge the riders' ability to stay in control, while maintaining maximum speed.

programme.title: RKJ Sailing Legend
programme.desc: Born in Putney, London, Sir William Robert Patrick Knox-Johnston served in the Merchant Navy, where he acquired his skills to later on become a British legend and be awarded the title of Sir.RKJ Sailing Legend is a 56-minute documentary about possibly the most famous sailor in modern times, Sir Robin Knox-Johnston. RKJ was the first man to sail non-stop and alone around the world back in 1969: Now on the 50th anniversary of his achievement, we want to rememorate his feat.Get on board RKJ Sailing Legend, the remarkable story of Knox-Johnston's voyage around the world and into history. Available on Nautical Channel.

programme.desc: Facing Waves - Episode 5 - Creeksand Coves

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Episode 4 Qingdao, China
programme.desc: The UIM-ABP Aquabike World Championship has headed to a brand new venue as the world's best riders step up a gear at the Grand Prix of Qingdao in China. This round three of the season has more than 60 riders gather for the best aquabike action. In this episode, we will bring you all the men's and women's ski action.Get ready to immerse yourself in the races happening at the Chinese seaport, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: UIM XCAT World Championship - Episode 1
programme.desc: UIM XCAT World Championship - Episode 1

programme.title: UIM XCAT World Championship - Ep1 - Italian GP
programme.desc: UIM XCAT World Championship - Ep1 - Italian GP

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 1
programme.desc: Andi is on a mission to discover the Tana River, Kenya’s longest river with a unique rapids system. In order to truly experience this region of the Tana, Andi has to learn to navigate the waters on a kayak. She tracks down river expert and professional Kayaker Kris Collyer and challenges him to learn his skill in three days. Andi is tested when she almost drowns trying to complete her mission.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode, Andi will discover the diverse marine ecosystem of Kilifi Creek. She will learn how to sail in three days in order to truly experience the creek. Andi goes 3 degrees south to meet Kevin, a local sailor who patiently teaches Andi the skills she needs in this short span of time. A true local experience is waiting if she can complete her training but failure is always lurking.

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 5
programme.desc: On this week's episode we have comedian and viral video sensation, Megan Mackay. She is best known for her comedic YouTube makeup tutorial videos, and her videos have been seen by more than 4.5 million people worldwide. Will she have the skills to jump on our paddleboard and take on our challenges?

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 6
programme.desc: Welcome to What SUP! On this week's episode we have the proclaimed Canadian singer-songwriter Royal Wood. This band has been nominated for their Juno song as songwriter of the year by iTunes in 2008, and his music has been featured in shows slike Greys Anatomy or Private Practice. But, singing won't save them from our paddleboard challenges, is he ready?

programme.title: Escape to Zanzibar - Episode 1
programme.desc: As soon as we arrive on the island, we begin to explore Zanzibar starting in the northern part of the country. Nungwi, our chosen location is a common touristic destination and its guests are famously welcoming. Let's begin our journey by visiting the famous sea turtle conservation and protection center. Buckle up for this adventure!

programme.title: Escape to Zanzibar - Episode 2
programme.desc: We begin this day of discoveries with a visit to the most important historical landmarks in Stone Town. For lunch, we head straight on to The Rock: one of Zanzibar's greatest icons. The restaurant was literally built on a rock and can only be reached on foot during the low tide. Then, we will follow Shabed's suggestion and dive into the water to try all the activities available.

programme.title: Surf Series: South Africa - Episode 3 - SA Open
programme.desc: The penultimate event of the South African Surf Series takes place at Pollock Beach. This is one of the highlights of the WSL Africa tour and features a Women’s QS 3000, Men’s QS 1000 and Junior Men and Women’s QS 1000 rated events. With a field of top international and local surfers, this event is bound to heat up as the best South African Surfers face off some formidable opponents. Fierce competition may see some position changes ahead of the final event of the series.

programme.title: Surf Series: South Africa - Episode 4 - Vic Bay
programme.desc: The Vic Bay Classic takes place in the winter months so expect the biggest swells and highest quality of surfing. Watch former CT contender fight for the win as the crowd cheers their local hero. The fight for the mens series winner gets even closer at this final event. Who will claim victory and take the overall series winnings in the season finale of the City Surf Series?

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 7
programme.desc: On episode seven of What SUP we have stand up and sketch comedian Stephanie Tolev. She was recently awarded 2015 Female Canadian Comedian of the year, and has performed at the prestigious Just For Laughs Comedy Festival across the country. We are ready to head down to the water with her and have some laughs, care to join in?

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 8
programme.desc: On this week's episode of What SUP we have comedian Dom Pare and the powerful rock band 20Amp. Dom is one of Chris' favourite comedians in Canada, and he is sure his quick wit and unconventional charm will win you over. We are taking him for some laughs on our paddle. Come watch along!

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 3
programme.desc: The Equator is the first big milestone on the long route that is covered by the Vendée Globe. Crossing from a hemisphere to another at latitude zero is a determinating factor in this competition. One of the competitors' boat needs urgent repairs, and two competitors sail within sight of each other. How are the participants going to overcome this week's challenges? Find it out in this week's episode of the Vendée Globe.

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 4
programme.desc: Sailors of this year's edition of the Vendée Globe get excited at the sight of a vessel after a month of solo travel. More competitors face technical difficulties and will have to prove they are worthy of this race by attending to the needs of their boats. For many, the Vendée Globe is more than just a race, it is a journey of self-discovery.

programme.title: Magnifique Martinique
programme.desc: Martinique is truly magnificent!The Caribbean Island is a paradise for both locals and visitors that year after year come to discover the mysteries of this island. Come discover the beauty of life in the Caribbean in this show.Nautical Channel’s host, Andrew Miller, will show you exciting new places and delicious local cuisine prepared by a great chef. Famous Caribbean Rum for breakfast and an intense session of fly boarding will guarantee madness fun in this exhilarating adventure in Magnifique Martinique.Follow Andrew on a unique discovery in this French holiday destination, on Nautical Channel.

programme.desc: The World Sailing Show - Episode 3

programme.title: Sylt - The Queen Of The North Sea
programme.desc: Welcome to Sylt! The northernmost island of Germany spreads for 40 kilometers and has been since ages a top nautical location. All year round you can find action here at the North Sea, and Nautical Channel host Lucia Metzbauer is ready to disembark in this location and explore the queen of the North Sea with our team. She will meet the locals, get to know the hidden gems, the best places for surfing and sailing, discover the wildlife and explore the enormous PWA Grand Slam in Sylt – the windsurfing event to be! Get ready to dive into Sylt's secrets as we wander around an UNESCO World Heritage Site and get splashed with the windsurf action. Let's get going to Sylt - The Queen of the North Sea!

programme.title: Rolex Spirit Of Yachting - Episode 4 - Fastnet Race
programme.desc: Rolex Spirit Of Yachting - Episode 4 - Fastnet Race

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 7
programme.desc: On episode seven of What SUP we have stand up and sketch comedian Stephanie Tolev. She was recently awarded 2015 Female Canadian Comedian of the year, and has performed at the prestigious Just For Laughs Comedy Festival across the country. We are ready to head down to the water with her and have some laughs, care to join in?

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 8
programme.desc: On this week's episode of What SUP we have comedian Dom Pare and the powerful rock band 20Amp. Dom is one of Chris' favourite comedians in Canada, and he is sure his quick wit and unconventional charm will win you over. We are taking him for some laughs on our paddle. Come watch along!

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 1
programme.desc: Andi is on a mission to discover the Tana River, Kenya’s longest river with a unique rapids system. In order to truly experience this region of the Tana, Andi has to learn to navigate the waters on a kayak. She tracks down river expert and professional Kayaker Kris Collyer and challenges him to learn his skill in three days. Andi is tested when she almost drowns trying to complete her mission.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode, Andi will discover the diverse marine ecosystem of Kilifi Creek. She will learn how to sail in three days in order to truly experience the creek. Andi goes 3 degrees south to meet Kevin, a local sailor who patiently teaches Andi the skills she needs in this short span of time. A true local experience is waiting if she can complete her training but failure is always lurking.

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Season Review - Runabout & Freestyle
programme.desc: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Season Review - Runabout & Freestyle

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Episode 4 Qingdao, China
programme.desc: The UIM-ABP Aquabike World Championship has headed to a brand new venue as the world's best riders step up a gear at the Grand Prix of Qingdao in China. This round three of the season has more than 60 riders gather for the best aquabike action. In this episode, we will bring you all the men's and women's ski action.Get ready to immerse yourself in the races happening at the Chinese seaport, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Magnifique Martinique
programme.desc: Martinique is truly magnificent!The Caribbean Island is a paradise for both locals and visitors that year after year come to discover the mysteries of this island. Come discover the beauty of life in the Caribbean in this show.Nautical Channel’s host, Andrew Miller, will show you exciting new places and delicious local cuisine prepared by a great chef. Famous Caribbean Rum for breakfast and an intense session of fly boarding will guarantee madness fun in this exhilarating adventure in Magnifique Martinique.Follow Andrew on a unique discovery in this French holiday destination, on Nautical Channel.

programme.desc: Facing Waves - Episode 6 - Alabama

programme.title: Escape to Zanzibar - Episode 1
programme.desc: As soon as we arrive on the island, we begin to explore Zanzibar starting in the northern part of the country. Nungwi, our chosen location is a common touristic destination and its guests are famously welcoming. Let's begin our journey by visiting the famous sea turtle conservation and protection center. Buckle up for this adventure!

programme.title: Escape to Zanzibar - Episode 2
programme.desc: We begin this day of discoveries with a visit to the most important historical landmarks in Stone Town. For lunch, we head straight on to The Rock: one of Zanzibar's greatest icons. The restaurant was literally built on a rock and can only be reached on foot during the low tide. Then, we will follow Shabed's suggestion and dive into the water to try all the activities available.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 5
programme.desc: First stop for this episode is the exotic destination and kiteboarding playground of Mauritius, for one of the most high-profile and biggest kite-foiling events: the Hydrofoil Pro Tour. From one island to another, we leave the exotic racetracks of Mauritius and head to Cagliari on Sardinia for another exciting gathering of the world's best kitefoiling riders. The World Championship also marked the close of the 2017 Kitefoil Gold Cup World Series.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 6
programme.desc: In this episode, we move to Dongshan, China for the 2017 Dongshan China International Kiteboarding Open. Combining culture with heritage, this small island, located along the Taiwan Strait, hosts a population of 200,000. The Youth Olympic Games is a hot topic in the Kiteboarding community, eagerly anticipated by riders and supporters. Reflecting an exciting and new race format, the slalom/boarder-cross is designed to challenge the riders' ability to stay in control, while maintaining maximum speed.

programme.title: Sail-Ho - Episode 10
programme.desc: The island of Rab has a rich history and has been inhabited by numerous great personalities. The Romans named this place Felix Arba or Lucky, which actually means Happy island. With 30 sandy beaches, Rab is truly a happy island and its beauty has been recognized by tourists from around the world for almost 125 years.

programme.title: Moana Waiwai
programme.desc: Moana Waiwai follows the Free Swim journey of wahine (woman) Ally Davey as she takes on 70km of open ocean around the stunning Coromandel coastline to bring awareness to the protection of New Zealand’s oceans.For over three days it does more than encapsulate stunning panoramas on the extraordinary scenario of New Zealand. It is also inspiring for people as we become aware of the natural beauty of the ocean so we can protect it before it is too late.This is an inspirational film, not an activist propaganda, that highlights exploration and the intrinsic benefits of getting wet and looking below the surface. In Moana Waiwai Ally Davey will champion endurance of her human spirit in this seemingly impossible task to achieve a higher goal: protection of the oceans.Be part of her adventure on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 3
programme.desc: We venture into Kenya’s wild coastline in the Watamu region. This Marine reserve is incredibly unique and in order for Andi to truly experience it she has to learn to kite surf in a very short period of time. She needs help, so she decides to track down the Tribe Watersports and Ben Kelliher who will guide her through a crash course in kitesurfing. If she can do it in the allocated time, Ben has an incredible prize waiting for her.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 4
programme.desc: Andi is back in the Watamu Marine Reserve but this time on a new mission: save the endangered sea turtles. She spends three days at the Local Ocean Trust with Marine Biologist Casper van de Geer. If Andi can learn the importance of sea turtles in the marine ecosystem and the vital skills needed to protect them, she might have the opportunity to release a turtle back into the wild.

programme.title: Maxiboat TV Show - Episode 3
programme.desc: Welcome to the third episode of Maxiboat. This month, we will be putting the brand new Beneteau GT45 to test. Then, French sailor Francois Gabart will show us his future offshore racing trimaran while we go for a quick tour around the Mer Concept shipyard in Concarneau. Finally, we shine on some highlights of the 2021 Jet Raid in Greece, the Dakar of the Seas or the longest jetski race in the world.

programme.title: Maxiboat TV Show - Episode 4
programme.desc: On the fourth episode of Maxiboat, we are back to the Monaco Energy Boat Challenge 2021 that gathered boats motored by alternative propulsion like hydrogen, electric motors and solar. Then we remember the best moments of the Super Yacht Cup in Palma. To finish off, we focus on an XXL Italian luxury rib Pirelli 35 and share the first images before the autumn boat shows of the X Power 33C, the first motor boat from the Danish shipyard X Yachts.

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 1
programme.desc: We are set to visit the rich in tradition village of Olimpos and to swim in the clear waters of some of the most beautiful beaches in the Mediterranean. Then, we will discover some of the secrets by the seabed of the island and the creatures that inhabit them. This episode would not be complete without trying a watersport, so we will try to fly on to a kitesurf. Will you fly away with us?

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 2
programme.desc: We take a stroll down the village of Arkansa, in the middle of Karpathos. The village is loved by tourists who have been coming for over 20 years. Then, we are going to explore some of the ruins of the island, starting in the north in the ancient Vrikous. The island is filled with Ancient Greek ruins we cannot miss on before boarding on a windsurf experience. With the Meltemi wind, Karpathos has become a windsurfing paradise.

programme.title: Sailing Documentary Show
programme.desc: Sailing boats have always come in different shapes and size. Whether if they are used for competition, fishing or recreational use, competition has always been at the heart of sport, pushing boundaries in technological advancements.The Extreme Sailing Series combines the top class sailing teams and the advanced innovations in technology, and watching the races becomes a thrill to spectators. With circuits that range through eight global events, the Extreme Sailing Series is breaking boundaries. Follow the journey of boats that are some of the fastest in production and that can reach speeds of just under 40 knots or almost 75 kilometres per hour.

programme.title: Guadeloupe: Caribbean Blues
programme.desc: A visit to Guadeloupe is like visiting all corners of our world’s beauty. Looking to the left you can catch a breeze that swifts a kite surfer in the air, and to the right a gust of smoke from the Soufriere’s volcanic top. Everything in between is a perfectly balanced mixture of colour, tradition, and a lifestyle to die for.Guadeloupe: Caribbean Blues takes us on a trip to this dreamy destination. Rhythm and music go hand in hand in the Caribbean as different styles combine forming unique masterpieces that have us all dancing in no time. Get ready to dance to the sound of music, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 5
programme.desc: First stop for this episode is the exotic destination and kiteboarding playground of Mauritius, for one of the most high-profile and biggest kite-foiling events: the Hydrofoil Pro Tour. From one island to another, we leave the exotic racetracks of Mauritius and head to Cagliari on Sardinia for another exciting gathering of the world's best kitefoiling riders. The World Championship also marked the close of the 2017 Kitefoil Gold Cup World Series.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 6
programme.desc: In this episode, we move to Dongshan, China for the 2017 Dongshan China International Kiteboarding Open. Combining culture with heritage, this small island, located along the Taiwan Strait, hosts a population of 200,000. The Youth Olympic Games is a hot topic in the Kiteboarding community, eagerly anticipated by riders and supporters. Reflecting an exciting and new race format, the slalom/boarder-cross is designed to challenge the riders' ability to stay in control, while maintaining maximum speed.

programme.title: Sylt - The Queen Of The North Sea
programme.desc: Welcome to Sylt! The northernmost island of Germany spreads for 40 kilometers and has been since ages a top nautical location. All year round you can find action here at the North Sea, and Nautical Channel host Lucia Metzbauer is ready to disembark in this location and explore the queen of the North Sea with our team. She will meet the locals, get to know the hidden gems, the best places for surfing and sailing, discover the wildlife and explore the enormous PWA Grand Slam in Sylt – the windsurfing event to be! Get ready to dive into Sylt's secrets as we wander around an UNESCO World Heritage Site and get splashed with the windsurf action. Let's get going to Sylt - The Queen of the North Sea!

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Episode 4 Qingdao, China
programme.desc: The UIM-ABP Aquabike World Championship has headed to a brand new venue as the world's best riders step up a gear at the Grand Prix of Qingdao in China. This round three of the season has more than 60 riders gather for the best aquabike action. In this episode, we will bring you all the men's and women's ski action.Get ready to immerse yourself in the races happening at the Chinese seaport, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 1
programme.desc: We are set to visit the rich in tradition village of Olimpos and to swim in the clear waters of some of the most beautiful beaches in the Mediterranean. Then, we will discover some of the secrets by the seabed of the island and the creatures that inhabit them. This episode would not be complete without trying a watersport, so we will try to fly on to a kitesurf. Will you fly away with us?

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 2
programme.desc: We take a stroll down the village of Arkansa, in the middle of Karpathos. The village is loved by tourists who have been coming for over 20 years. Then, we are going to explore some of the ruins of the island, starting in the north in the ancient Vrikous. The island is filled with Ancient Greek ruins we cannot miss on before boarding on a windsurf experience. With the Meltemi wind, Karpathos has become a windsurfing paradise.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 3
programme.desc: We venture into Kenya’s wild coastline in the Watamu region. This Marine reserve is incredibly unique and in order for Andi to truly experience it she has to learn to kite surf in a very short period of time. She needs help, so she decides to track down the Tribe Watersports and Ben Kelliher who will guide her through a crash course in kitesurfing. If she can do it in the allocated time, Ben has an incredible prize waiting for her.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 4
programme.desc: Andi is back in the Watamu Marine Reserve but this time on a new mission: save the endangered sea turtles. She spends three days at the Local Ocean Trust with Marine Biologist Casper van de Geer. If Andi can learn the importance of sea turtles in the marine ecosystem and the vital skills needed to protect them, she might have the opportunity to release a turtle back into the wild.

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 7
programme.desc: On episode seven of What SUP we have stand up and sketch comedian Stephanie Tolev. She was recently awarded 2015 Female Canadian Comedian of the year, and has performed at the prestigious Just For Laughs Comedy Festival across the country. We are ready to head down to the water with her and have some laughs, care to join in?

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 8
programme.desc: On this week's episode of What SUP we have comedian Dom Pare and the powerful rock band 20Amp. Dom is one of Chris' favourite comedians in Canada, and he is sure his quick wit and unconventional charm will win you over. We are taking him for some laughs on our paddle. Come watch along!

programme.title: Magnifique Martinique
programme.desc: Martinique is truly magnificent!The Caribbean Island is a paradise for both locals and visitors that year after year come to discover the mysteries of this island. Come discover the beauty of life in the Caribbean in this show.Nautical Channel’s host, Andrew Miller, will show you exciting new places and delicious local cuisine prepared by a great chef. Famous Caribbean Rum for breakfast and an intense session of fly boarding will guarantee madness fun in this exhilarating adventure in Magnifique Martinique.Follow Andrew on a unique discovery in this French holiday destination, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: OFQUI
programme.desc: The Isthmus of Ofqui, unknown for many and chosen as surf destination by few adventurers.The stretch of land that separates the Pacific Ocean's inland seas, is the only way to make it if you want to surf the shores of Golfo de Penas. Connecting the Taitao Peninsula with the Chilean mainland, Ofqui offers world class waves. This thaw surf film approaches the vast territory of the Patagonia in different ways, this time, centered around Ofqui.Pro surfers will face ice-cold waters in their expedition to surf deathly waves in Ofqui, one of the most unknown locations of the Patagonia and with a microclimate that maximises the upcoming waves.Join them in their adventure to Ofqui here, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: RORC Caribbean 600
programme.desc: The RORC Caribbean 600 is an exciting 600-mile offshore race that takes competitors around some of the most beautiful islands of the Caribbean. In its 12th edition, more than 73 boats from 22 countries joined in a competition with participants from over 37 different nationalities.The fleet is made up not only of professional sailors and their boats, but also with Corinthian amateurs that love this offshore race. As it is the only offshore race in the Caribbean, it gets the attention of the best sailors worldwide. The race starts and finishes in Antigua and weaves its way around 11 different islands including St. Maarten and Guadaloupe amongst them.Be part of this unique race across the Caribbean with Nautical Channel and find out what crew will raise with victory.

programme.title: Posh Port - Madeira
programme.desc: In this episode, host Andi van Zyl gets an inside look at the eco-friendly Quinta do Lorde of Portugal's Madeira island. We will interview the Marina Manager at this dazzling destination and Andi will explore the marina and surrounding coastline. Then, she will learn how to cook a delicious traditional platter and even go sailing taking a dive with dolphins!

programme.title: Posh Port - Montenegro
programme.desc: Posh Ports is a new Nautical Channel original series which takes viewers on exclusive tours of the world’s most extravagant marinas, and yacht clubs! In this episode, host Andrew Miller gets an inside look at the luxurious Porto Montenegro, explores the surrounding coastline, and puts his safety on the line wakeboarding in the marina!

programme.title: MAR
programme.desc: Surfing has ceased a long time ago to be considered a niche sport. As the mainstream industry discovers its potential for selling clothes, trips and a whole set of ‘lifestyle’ products, there are those who appreciate it for what it is in its purest form – a direct connection to mother nature.We accompany Big Wave surfer Alex Botelho and some of his friends to meet surfers who balance their love for the ocean and nature with a professional career in the sport. Mar is a tale of discovery, triumph and (almost) tragedy, but above all it is a life affirming pledge to positive vibes in and out of the line-up.Get ready to soak up a new conception of the world of surf as Alex Botelho unveils concepts unknown for the mainstream audience, available on Nautical Channel.Awards:Best Feature Documentary – Best Istanbul Film Festival 2021. Official Selections 2021: Ocean Film Festival World Tour, International Ocean Film Festival.

Dom is one of Chris' favourite comedians in Canada, and he is sure his quick wit and unconventional charm will win you over. We are taking him for some laughs on our paddle. Come watch along!

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 3
programme.desc: We venture into Kenya’s wild coastline in the Watamu region. This Marine reserve is incredibly unique and in order for Andi to truly experience it she has to learn to kite surf in a very short period of time. She needs help, so she decides to track down the Tribe Watersports and Ben Kelliher who will guide her through a crash course in kitesurfing. If she can do it in the allocated time, Ben has an incredible prize waiting for her.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 4
programme.desc: Andi is back in the Watamu Marine Reserve but this time on a new mission: save the endangered sea turtles. She spends three days at the Local Ocean Trust with Marine Biologist Casper van de Geer. If Andi can learn the importance of sea turtles in the marine ecosystem and the vital skills needed to protect them, she might have the opportunity to release a turtle back into the wild.

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Season Review - Runabout & Freestyle
programme.desc: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Season Review - Runabout & Freestyle

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Episode 4 Qingdao, China
programme.desc: The UIM-ABP Aquabike World Championship has headed to a brand new venue as the world's best riders step up a gear at the Grand Prix of Qingdao in China. This round three of the season has more than 60 riders gather for the best aquabike action. In this episode, we will bring you all the men's and women's ski action.Get ready to immerse yourself in the races happening at the Chinese seaport, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Facing Waves - Episode 7 - OKC
programme.desc: Facing Waves - Episode 7 - OKC

programme.desc: Facing Waves - Episode 8 - Oswego

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 3
programme.desc: The World Sailing Show - Episode 3

programme.title: Sylt - The Queen Of The North Sea
programme.desc: Welcome to Sylt! The northernmost island of Germany spreads for 40 kilometers and has been since ages a top nautical location. All year round you can find action here at the North Sea, and Nautical Channel host Lucia Metzbauer is ready to disembark in this location and explore the queen of the North Sea with our team. She will meet the locals, get to know the hidden gems, the best places for surfing and sailing, discover the wildlife and explore the enormous PWA Grand Slam in Sylt – the windsurfing event to be! Get ready to dive into Sylt's secrets as we wander around an UNESCO World Heritage Site and get splashed with the windsurf action. Let's get going to Sylt - The Queen of the North Sea!

programme.title: Of Men and Mavericks
programme.desc: After getting inspired by Chasing Mavericks, a movie featuring Gerard Butler, Of Men and Mavericks covers the story of surfing legends like Peter Mel, Jeff Clark and Mark Foo in their attempts to surf mavericks. They recount their first ventures in the Half Moon Bay spot and how they managed to conquer waves that reached more than 8 meters of height.Their perseverance, enthusiasm and willingness got them time after time into the cold waters of San Francisco to attempt a dangerous task that could have fatal repercussions. Their goal: to surf some of the biggest waves in the world.Follow the path of these brave surfers who leave it all behind to surf big waves, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 1
programme.desc: Together we’ll travel across the globe and follow the hottest action from the field of Kite! In this Episode, we have the opportunity to witnessup and coming young guns from 4 continents, fighting for their chance to live the Olympic Dream! Dakhla, in Morocco hosts the qualifying event for Europe and Africa, while Pranburi, Thailand is the place where riders from Asia and Oceania will fight for their right to compete in Argentina!

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode we are going to take you into the action from the 2018 milestone event, the International Kiteboarding Association, TT:R Youth Worlds. The fastest young athletes from across the globe have gathered on China’s tropical Hainan Island. With 8 qualification spots available for this year’s Youth Olympic Games in Argentina, expect the competition to be fierce!

programme.title: The Boat Show - Episode 17
programme.desc: The Boat Show - Episode 17

programme.title: The Boat Show - Episode 18
programme.desc: The Boat Show - Episode 18

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 1
programme.desc: We are set to visit the rich in tradition village of Olimpos and to swim in the clear waters of some of the most beautiful beaches in the Mediterranean. Then, we will discover some of the secrets by the seabed of the island and the creatures that inhabit them. This episode would not be complete without trying a watersport, so we will try to fly on to a kitesurf. Will you fly away with us?

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 2
programme.desc: We take a stroll down the village of Arkansa, in the middle of Karpathos. The village is loved by tourists who have been coming for over 20 years. Then, we are going to explore some of the ruins of the island, starting in the north in the ancient Vrikous. The island is filled with Ancient Greek ruins we cannot miss on before boarding on a windsurf experience. With the Meltemi wind, Karpathos has become a windsurfing paradise.

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Season Review - Runabout & Freestyle
programme.desc: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Season Review - Runabout & Freestyle

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Episode 4 Qingdao, China
programme.desc: The UIM-ABP Aquabike World Championship has headed to a brand new venue as the world's best riders step up a gear at the Grand Prix of Qingdao in China. This round three of the season has more than 60 riders gather for the best aquabike action. In this episode, we will bring you all the men's and women's ski action.Get ready to immerse yourself in the races happening at the Chinese seaport, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Posh Port - Madeira
programme.desc: In this episode, host Andi van Zyl gets an inside look at the eco-friendly Quinta do Lorde of Portugal's Madeira island. We will interview the Marina Manager at this dazzling destination and Andi will explore the marina and surrounding coastline. Then, she will learn how to cook a delicious traditional platter and even go sailing taking a dive with dolphins!

programme.title: Posh Port - Montenegro
programme.desc: Posh Ports is a new Nautical Channel original series which takes viewers on exclusive tours of the world’s most extravagant marinas, and yacht clubs! In this episode, host Andrew Miller gets an inside look at the luxurious Porto Montenegro, explores the surrounding coastline, and puts his safety on the line wakeboarding in the marina!

programme.title: Magnifique Martinique
programme.desc: Martinique is truly magnificent!The Caribbean Island is a paradise for both locals and visitors that year after year come to discover the mysteries of this island. Come discover the beauty of life in the Caribbean in this show.Nautical Channel’s host, Andrew Miller, will show you exciting new places and delicious local cuisine prepared by a great chef. Famous Caribbean Rum for breakfast and an intense session of fly boarding will guarantee madness fun in this exhilarating adventure in Magnifique Martinique.Follow Andrew on a unique discovery in this French holiday destination, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Posh Port - Madeira
programme.desc: In this episode, host Andi van Zyl gets an inside look at the eco-friendly Quinta do Lorde of Portugal's Madeira island. We will interview the Marina Manager at this dazzling destination and Andi will explore the marina and surrounding coastline. Then, she will learn how to cook a delicious traditional platter and even go sailing taking a dive with dolphins!

programme.title: Posh Port - Montenegro
programme.desc: Posh Ports is a new Nautical Channel original series which takes viewers on exclusive tours of the world’s most extravagant marinas, and yacht clubs! In this episode, host Andrew Miller gets an inside look at the luxurious Porto Montenegro, explores the surrounding coastline, and puts his safety on the line wakeboarding in the marina!

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 1
programme.desc: We are set to visit the rich in tradition village of Olimpos and to swim in the clear waters of some of the most beautiful beaches in the Mediterranean. Then, we will discover some of the secrets by the seabed of the island and the creatures that inhabit them. This episode would not be complete without trying a watersport, so we will try to fly on to a kitesurf. Will you fly away with us?

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 2
programme.desc: We take a stroll down the village of Arkansa, in the middle of Karpathos. The village is loved by tourists who have been coming for over 20 years. Then, we are going to explore some of the ruins of the island, starting in the north in the ancient Vrikous. The island is filled with Ancient Greek ruins we cannot miss on before boarding on a windsurf experience. With the Meltemi wind, Karpathos has become a windsurfing paradise.

programme.title: Magnifique Martinique
programme.desc: Martinique is truly magnificent!The Caribbean Island is a paradise for both locals and visitors that year after year come to discover the mysteries of this island. Come discover the beauty of life in the Caribbean in this show.Nautical Channel’s host, Andrew Miller, will show you exciting new places and delicious local cuisine prepared by a great chef. Famous Caribbean Rum for breakfast and an intense session of fly boarding will guarantee madness fun in this exhilarating adventure in Magnifique Martinique.Follow Andrew on a unique discovery in this French holiday destination, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 3
programme.desc: We venture into Kenya’s wild coastline in the Watamu region. This Marine reserve is incredibly unique and in order for Andi to truly experience it she has to learn to kite surf in a very short period of time. She needs help, so she decides to track down the Tribe Watersports and Ben Kelliher who will guide her through a crash course in kitesurfing. If she can do it in the allocated time, Ben has an incredible prize waiting for her.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 4
programme.desc: Andi is back in the Watamu Marine Reserve but this time on a new mission: save the endangered sea turtles. She spends three days at the Local Ocean Trust with Marine Biologist Casper van de Geer. If Andi can learn the importance of sea turtles in the marine ecosystem and the vital skills needed to protect them, she might have the opportunity to release a turtle back into the wild.

programme.title: FUN FOIL FEST - España Mar Menor - Los Alcázares
programme.desc: FUN FOIL FEST - España Mar Menor - Los Alcázares

programme.title: Garrett McNamara & The Essence Of Big Wave
programme.desc: Garrett ‘GMAC’ McNamara is the American professional big wave surfer and extreme waterman known for breaking the world record for the largest wave ever surfed at Nazaré, Portugal. Surviving monstrous waves at Jaws, riding tsunamis from calving glaciers in Alaska and many more feats that are impossible to even imagine for many.Catch this exclusive half-hour special of Garrett McNamara & The Essence of Big Wave to understand his drive to get into the water despite knowing he’s risking his life. Find out more about his struggles, life-changing decisions, and the injuries that have made him become the legend he is today. From his earliest surfing days in Hawaii to world record success G-Mac tells it all.

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 9
programme.desc: This is the final episode of the season and we want to end with a big finale. This is why we have comedian Mike Rita on tonight's episode. He has quickly branded himself as one of Canada's top comedic performers, and his writing can be heard on Vice TV. Let's hit the water with Mike!

programme.title: Eurosaf Championship Tavira
programme.desc: The EUROSAF (European Sailing Federation) Championship will take place in the waters off the Portuguese town of Tavira. The 19 sailing champions of Europe will be crowned in this gathering that has over 150 sailors and more than 100 boats and boards compete against triumph. 14 European countries have sent their best sailors to compete in eight different disciplines, including single-handed and double-handed dinghies, plus sailboards and high performance dinghy. They will compete over the 5-day competition to choose the youth champion of Europe in each of these disciplines. Follow the competition of the future talent of the sailing world as they sail across the waters of Tavira, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 5
programme.desc: Athletes have reached the Indian Ocean and take advantage of nice swells that push their boats forward and closer to the end line. Reaching 35 knots, they have to make the most of these situations, as the Indian Ocean is a rollercoaster and highly unpredictable. They embrace high winds and face new dangers. Find out what happens this week in the Vendée Globe.

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 6
programme.desc: Reaching the Roaring Forties, more competitors lose their well earned advantage due to technical issues in their boats. Once more, they will have to prove they are not only sailors, but also mechanics, constructors and architects. They are in the middle of the Indian Ocean and the race is really close and anyone could take the lead at any moment.

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 3
programme.desc: The World Sailing Show - Episode 3

programme.title: Sylt - The Queen Of The North Sea
programme.desc: Welcome to Sylt! The northernmost island of Germany spreads for 40 kilometers and has been since ages a top nautical location. All year round you can find action here at the North Sea, and Nautical Channel host Lucia Metzbauer is ready to disembark in this location and explore the queen of the North Sea with our team. She will meet the locals, get to know the hidden gems, the best places for surfing and sailing, discover the wildlife and explore the enormous PWA Grand Slam in Sylt – the windsurfing event to be! Get ready to dive into Sylt's secrets as we wander around an UNESCO World Heritage Site and get splashed with the windsurf action. Let's get going to Sylt - The Queen of the North Sea!

Catch the highlights of this eight days sailing event only on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 3
programme.desc: We venture into Kenya’s wild coastline in the Watamu region. This Marine reserve is incredibly unique and in order for Andi to truly experience it she has to learn to kite surf in a very short period of time. She needs help, so she decides to track down the Tribe Watersports and Ben Kelliher who will guide her through a crash course in kitesurfing. If she can do it in the allocated time, Ben has an incredible prize waiting for her.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 4
programme.desc: Andi is back in the Watamu Marine Reserve but this time on a new mission: save the endangered sea turtles. She spends three days at the Local Ocean Trust with Marine Biologist Casper van de Geer. If Andi can learn the importance of sea turtles in the marine ecosystem and the vital skills needed to protect them, she might have the opportunity to release a turtle back into the wild.

programme.title: Posh Port - Madeira
programme.desc: In this episode, host Andi van Zyl gets an inside look at the eco-friendly Quinta do Lorde of Portugal's Madeira island. We will interview the Marina Manager at this dazzling destination and Andi will explore the marina and surrounding coastline. Then, she will learn how to cook a delicious traditional platter and even go sailing taking a dive with dolphins!

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 1
programme.desc: Together we’ll travel across the globe and follow the hottest action from the field of Kite! In this Episode, we have the opportunity to witnessup and coming young guns from 4 continents, fighting for their chance to live the Olympic Dream! Dakhla, in Morocco hosts the qualifying event for Europe and Africa, while Pranburi, Thailand is the place where riders from Asia and Oceania will fight for their right to compete in Argentina!

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode we are going to take you into the action from the 2018 milestone event, the International Kiteboarding Association, TT:R Youth Worlds. The fastest young athletes from across the globe have gathered on China’s tropical Hainan Island. With 8 qualification spots available for this year’s Youth Olympic Games in Argentina, expect the competition to be fierce!

programme.title: Posh Port - Madeira
programme.desc: In this episode, host Andi van Zyl gets an inside look at the eco-friendly Quinta do Lorde of Portugal's Madeira island. Then, she will learn how to cook a delicious traditional platter and even go sailing taking a dive with dolphins!

programme.title: Posh Port - Montenegro
programme.desc: Posh Ports is a new Nautical Channel original series which takes viewers on exclusive tours of the world’s most extravagant marinas, and yacht clubs! In this episode, host Andrew Miller gets an inside look at the luxurious Porto Montenegro, explores the surrounding coastline, and puts his safety on the line wakeboarding in the marina!

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 1
programme.desc: We are set to visit the rich in tradition village of Olimpos and to swim in the clear waters of some of the most beautiful beaches in the Mediterranean. Then, we will discover some of the secrets by the seabed of the island and the creatures that inhabit them. This episode would not be complete without trying a watersport, so we will try to fly on to a kitesurf. Will you fly away with us?

programme.title: Discovering Karpathos - Part 2
programme.desc: We take a stroll down the village of Arkansa, in the middle of Karpathos. The village is loved by tourists who have been coming for over 20 years. Then, we are going to explore some of the ruins of the island, starting in the north in the ancient Vrikous. The island is filled with Ancient Greek ruins we cannot miss on before boarding on a windsurf experience. With the Meltemi wind, Karpathos has become a windsurfing paradise.

programme.title: Nastro Rosa Tour - Review
programme.desc: A sports format, innovative and spectacular. An international tour along the mediterranean coasts and lighthouses of the Mediterranean sea.A series of multi-disciplinary sailing events, in an exclusive Italian concept consisting of stages that will touch some of the most beautiful Italian and Mediterranean coastal resorts.

programme.title: Mr. Price Pro Ballito
programme.desc: Follow the world leaders of surfing as they come to South Africa, Willard beach Ballito. 96 competitors from 18 countries will surf for the 250,000$ prize. Also, music concerts filled with South African bands will be cheering the best surfers of the world with their jamming.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 5
programme.desc: In this episode, Andi arrives to the ancient Arabic town of Lamu. She is about to discover what dhow culture means to the people of Kenya. She spends three days with the incredible Ali Lamu, dhow builder and carpenter who is trying to save the lost art of dhow building. A unique experience will reveal many secrets of the location and this traditional work that is getting lost amongst younger people.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - South Africa - Episode 1
programme.desc: Welcome to Simon's Town, the neighbour port down here in Cape Town. Today on Ocean Safari we are meeting up with Roger Hudson and Asenathi Jim. This is the perfect representation of what the rainbow nation stands for. We will hear the story of these two individuals from completely different backgrounds join together to form a union and represent South Africa at the London Olympic Games. Let's find out more now on this first episode of Ocean Safari: South Africa!

programme.title: Maxiboat TV Show - Episode 5
programme.desc: In this fifth episode of Maxiboat, spotlight is on the new products from Dufour Yachts, including the arrival of the Dufour 61 and Dufour 470. Then, we will perform complete trial of the new Sunseeker 55 EVO, an open yacht from the UK. Luxury is once again with the latest models from the Italian shipyard Riva: Folgore 88', Dolce Riva, or the 68' Diable, and we are ready to grasp some action of the first images.Lastly, we will discover a not-so-well known profession at the Moana Yachting based in Cannes, on the French Riviera.

programme.title: Maxiboat TV Show - Episode 6
programme.desc: In the sixth episode of Maxiboat, we travel to the Cannes Yachting Festival 2021 for a very special show. On the programme: an exclusive interview with Nico Rosberg, former Formula 1 driver and new Sunreef multihull ambassador, a discovery of the new 2022 sailing boats and a visit on board the EVO v8, an incredible motoryacht from Italy. Also on the programme is the Hynova, a hydrogen-powered motorboat of the future, and the best moments of the Yachting Festival Elegance Contest.

programme.title: The South To Sian Journals
programme.desc: While filming South To Sian, a pair of adventurers dived into what began as a three-month trip and turned into a two-year odyssey of exploration.On boards, bikes, by boat and four-wheel drive, Harrison Roach and Zye Norris discovered if, in these days of GPS and WiFi, the dream of a true pioneering surf adventure is still alive.South to Sian Journals is a collection of stories documenting the people, places & adventures that occurred during the 2 years making “South To Sian” - the challenges, the surfers, riders, shapers, bike builders, filmmakers and photographers.Extremely entertaining and insightful, “Journals” documents the travels, the hardships, the spectacular locations, the personalities and the thoughts of the characters, both in front of and behind the lens.

programme.title: Clipper: The Race Of Their Lives - Episode 1
programme.desc: Welcome to the eleventh edition of the biennial race of Clipper: The Race of Their Lives. 700 participants representing over 40 nations will take on the challenge of dealing with whatever 'Mother Nature' has in store. They will battle the elements out on the world's greatest oceans and will experiences the toughest conditions imaginable: from hurricane force winds to squalls that can knock a boat flat. Find out now what will happen in this unique challenge.

The fastest young athletes from across the globe have gathered on China’s tropical Hainan Island. With 8 qualification spots available for this year’s Youth Olympic Games in Argentina, expect the competition to be fierce!

programme.title: Posh Port - Madeira
programme.desc: In this episode, host Andi van Zyl gets an inside look at the eco-friendly Quinta do Lorde of Portugal's Madeira island. We will interview the Marina Manager at this dazzling destination and Andi will explore the marina and surrounding coastline. Then, she will learn how to cook a delicious traditional platter and even go sailing taking a dive with dolphins!

programme.title: Posh Port - Montenegro
programme.desc: Posh Ports is a new Nautical Channel original series which takes viewers on exclusive tours of the world’s most extravagant marinas, and yacht clubs! In this episode, host Andrew Miller gets an inside look at the luxurious Porto Montenegro, explores the surrounding coastline, and puts his safety on the line wakeboarding in the marina!

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 9
programme.desc: This is the final episode of the season and we want to end with a big finale. This is why we have comedian Mike Rita on tonight's episode. He has quickly branded himself as one of Canada's top comedic performers, and his writing can be heard on Vice TV. Let's hit the water with Mike!

programme.title: Eurosaf Championship Tavira
programme.desc: The EUROSAF (European Sailing Federation) Championship will take place in the waters off the Portuguese town of Tavira. The 19 sailing champions of Europe will be crowned in this gathering that has over 150 sailors and more than 100 boats and boards compete against triumph. 14 European countries have sent their best sailors to compete in eight different disciplines, including single-handed and double-handed dinghies, plus sailboards and high performance dinghy. They will compete over the 5-day competition to choose the youth champion of Europe in each of these disciplines. Follow the competition of the future talent of the sailing world as they sail across the waters of Tavira, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: PRADA 36th America's Cup - The Last Call Documentary
programme.desc: The competition in the PRADA 36th America’s Cup has come to an end, but we cannot leave without a tribute. In The Last Call Documentary, we go back in time to see the best moments and talk with the characters that define the present and future of the America's Cup. From the preparation for the PRADA Cup to the result in the 36th America's Cup Match find it all out.

programme.desc: SSL Gold Cup - Ep.2- Highlight

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Episode 4bis Freestyle Qingdao, China
programme.desc: Located in the Shandong province, along the Yellow Sea coast, Quindao is a modern metropolis with a dynamic vibe. This city is the chosen scenery for the third round of the 2019 UIM ABP season. In this episode, we will be focusing on the Runabout and Freestyle action of the Haier Grand Prix of Qingdao.Tune in for the best aquabike action!

programme.title: The South To Sian Journals
programme.desc: While filming South To Sian, a pair of adventurers dived into what began as a three-month trip and turned into a two-year odyssey of exploration.On boards, bikes, by boat and four-wheel drive, Harrison Roach and Zye Norris discovered if, in these days of GPS and WiFi, the dream of a true pioneering surf adventure is still alive.South to Sian Journals is a collection of stories documenting the people, places & adventures that occurred during the 2 years making “South To Sian” - the challenges, the surfers, riders, shapers, bike builders, filmmakers and photographers.Extremely entertaining and insightful, “Journals” documents the travels, the hardships, the spectacular locations, the personalities and the thoughts of the characters, both in front of and behind the lens.
