programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 5
programme.desc: In this episode, Andi arrives to the ancient Arabic town of Lamu. She is about to discover what dhow culture means to the people of Kenya. She spends three days with the incredible Ali Lamu, dhow builder and carpenter who is trying to save the lost art of dhow building. A unique experience will reveal many secrets of the location and this traditional work that is getting lost amongst younger people.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - South Africa - Episode 1
programme.desc: Welcome to Simon's Town, the neighbour port down here in Cape Town. Today on Ocean Safari we are meeting up with Roger Hudson and Asenathi Jim. This is the perfect representation of what the rainbow nation stands for. We will hear the story of these two individuals from completely different backgrounds join together to form a union and represent South Africa at the London Olympic Games. Let's find out more now on this first episode of Ocean Safari: South Africa!

programme.title: The Smoke that Thunders
programme.desc: In 1855, the Scottish explorer David Livingstone named the Victoria Falls after his reigning queen. However, the Kalolo-Lozi people had their own name for it: Mosi-oa-Tunya, “the smoke that thunders”.Staring down into the depths of the mighty Zambezi River from the top of the world’s largest waterfall, the Victoria Falls, world-class divers Orlando Duque and Jonathan Paredes prepare for the most challenging dive of their lives.Be part of their adventure as they dive into the largest waterfall in the world in The Smoke that Thunders, available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Surf The Alps - Winter Kiting In St Moritz
programme.desc: The ice cold winter of Switzerland, wind, a board and a kite! Welcome to the adventure of winter kiting! Join us as we visit the oldest snowkiting school in the world and admire the action the snowkiting legends put up. All of this on the immense frozen Silvaplana Lake in the middle of the highest peaks of the Swiss Alps.

programme.title: Undercurrents
programme.desc: Undercurrents explores connection and compassion through the eyes of two female surfers as they share their motivation time after time to go back to the water despite cold waves, fears and little reward. Bringing in ideas from the Blue Mind movement and science of mindfulness, get ready to flow with the blue ocean as we explore the relationship with the sea to find out what happens when we pursue what we love.Arlene Maltman is one of first British & European female surfing champions. Natalie Fox is a Yogi, Surf instructor and marine activist. Throughout the film, they share their experiences and relationship with the sea.Neuroscientist & Mindfulness innovator Dr Tamara Russell & Blue Health Coach / Blue Mind Advocate, Lizzi Larbalestier provide expertise on how our minds and bodies are connected to the ocean and how this can have a benefit to our health and wellbeing.Awards:New Talent Award – Adventure Uncovered Film Festival 2020. Best Adventure Film – Shexreme Film Festival 2019.

In The Last Call Documentary, we go back in time to see the best moments and talk with the characters that define the present and future of the America's Cup. From the preparation for the PRADA Cup to the result in the 36th America's Cup Match find it all out.

programme.title: SSL Gold Cup - Ep.2- Highlight
programme.desc: SSL Gold Cup - Ep.2- Highlight

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Episode 4bis Freestyle Qingdao, China
programme.desc: Located in the Shandong province, along the Yellow Sea coast, Quindao is a modern metropolis with a dynamic vibe. This city is the chosen scenery for the third round of the 2019 UIM ABP season. In this episode, we will be focusing on the Runabout and Freestyle action of the Haier Grand Prix of Qingdao.Tune in for the best aquabike action!

programme.title: The South To Sian Journals
programme.desc: While filming South To Sian, a pair of adventurers dived into what began as a three-month trip and turned into a two-year odyssey of exploration.On boards, bikes, by boat and four-wheel drive, Harrison Roach and Zye Norris discovered if, in these days of GPS and WiFi, the dream of a true pioneering surf adventure is still alive.South to Sian Journals is a collection of stories documenting the people, places & adventures that occurred during the 2 years making “South To Sian” - the challenges, the surfers, riders, shapers, bike builders, filmmakers and photographers.Extremely entertaining and insightful, “Journals” documents the travels, the hardships, the spectacular locations, the personalities and the thoughts of the characters, both in front of and behind the lens.

programme.title: What Sup - Episode 9
programme.desc: This is the final episode of the season and we want to end with a big finale. This is why we have comedian Mike Rita on tonight's episode. He has quickly branded himself as one of Canada's top comedic performers, and his writing can be heard on Vice TV. Let's hit the water with Mike!

programme.title: Eurosaf Championship Tavira
programme.desc: The EUROSAF (European Sailing Federation) Championship will take place in the waters off the Portuguese town of Tavira. The 19 sailing champions of Europe will be crowned in this gathering that has over 150 sailors and more than 100 boats and boards compete against triumph. 14 European countries have sent their best sailors to compete in eight different disciplines, including single-handed and double-handed dinghies, plus sailboards and high performance dinghy. They will compete over the 5-day competition to choose the youth champion of Europe in each of these disciplines. Follow the competition of the future talent of the sailing world as they sail across the waters of Tavira, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 5
programme.desc: In this episode, Andi arrives to the ancient Arabic town of Lamu. She is about to discover what dhow culture means to the people of Kenya. She spends three days with the incredible Ali Lamu, dhow builder and carpenter who is trying to save the lost art of dhow building. A unique experience will reveal many secrets of the location and this traditional work that is getting lost amongst younger people.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - South Africa - Episode 1
programme.desc: Welcome to Simon's Town, the neighbour port down here in Cape Town. Today on Ocean Safari we are meeting up with Roger Hudson and Asenathi Jim. This is the perfect representation of what the rainbow nation stands for. We will hear the story of these two individuals from completely different backgrounds join together to form a union and represent South Africa at the London Olympic Games. Let's find out more now on this first episode of Ocean Safari: South Africa!

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 1 Departure
programme.desc: In the 2013 edition of the The 'Transat Jacques Vabre' the multihulls and monohulls start at Le Havre and are set to arrive to Itajai in Brazil. For even a shot at victory in this extreme test of endurance and maritime skill, each team must find a way to maintain a world class sailing performance all while living together under excruciating conditions.Watch the departure and start of the Transat Jacques Vabre 2013, available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 2 Arrival
programme.desc: The multihulls and monohulls are competing to the extreme in order to arrive in first place at Itajai in Brazil. After the non-stop 5,450 nautical mile course from France to Brazil, the skippers see the bright light ahead and rush towards Brazilian shores. What team will be the ultimate winner of this year's edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre? Find out on the 2013 edition of this transatlantic ocean competition.

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 1
programme.desc: In this first episode of Screen Heroes, you can expect some insights in the world of surfing cinema. Today we are in Hamburg, Germany, to check out Hamburg's annual Surf and Skate Festival. Then, we will be taking you to California where we will feature the San Diego Surf Film Festival. Let's go!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 2
programme.desc: Welcome to today's episode of Screen Heroes! We are in San Sebastian, not only one of Spain's most beautiful cities, but also home to one of the most important surfing festivals in the world. Then, we get transported to the African coastline with The African Project before returning to San Sebastian to discover what's inside the Teatro Principal.

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 1
programme.desc: The time has come for athletes to leave Sables d'Olonne and embark in the journey of their lives. This solo journey will have them push their limits to attempt the extraordinary: circumnavigate around the globe. The boats cross the starting line, but one faces a penalty of 5 hours for leaving early. Find out more about their journey and weekly advances, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 2
programme.desc: We continue our journey in the Vendée Globe. One of the sailors had to return to Sables d'Olonne as his ship encountered some technical issues while the rest of the athletes continue the regatta. They will face their first tropical storm and fight to remain on route in one of the hardest competitions of the world.

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 1
programme.desc: On this month’s show we will witness the first capsize of an AC75 caught on video as America’s Cup Defenders Emirates Team New Zealand took a tumble off Auckland Harbour. We also dive into the climax of the Brest Atlantiques which saw some of the greatest sailors race the biggest trimarans around the Atlantic. Next, we will update you on SailGP's two new teams for the new season and action from the Grand Finale of the Star Sailors League in the Bahamas. Plenty of end of season world championships have recently taken place - we bring you the action and the new world medallists from Kiteboarding, Windsurfing and three sailing classes.

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 2
programme.desc: On this episode we start a new series building up to this summer’s Olympic Games, and we will be looking at the favourites for medals in the 470 and bring you our guide to the sailing venue in Enoshima. Then, the Sydney to Hobart is a highlight of the sailing calendar but the 75th edition was particularly special with the largest fleet in many years. We tell the story of the race and hear from the winners.Later on in The World Sailing Show, the longest intercontinental race of the southern hemisphere gets off to a flying start. We’re on board Maserati multi 70 to hear how Italy’s favourite sailor Giovanni Soldini plans to win the Cape to Rio race.Also, for the first time in its 63 year history the Finn Gold Cup was won by a New Zealander – we find out how he did it.Come join us as we embark into the world of sailing!

programme.desc: Skippers are getting ready for the 2022 edition of the Vendée Arctique: the solo race that surrounds Iceland before returning back to Les Sables d'Olonne. Jérémie Beyou became the winner of the 2020 edition of this arduous competition, but seeing the trajectory of Charlie Dalin and Thomas Ruyant, competition is closest than ever. Unpredictability in weather forecasts will force organizers to cut the race short, meaning skippers are running out of time to reduce distances.

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 1
programme.desc: In this first episode of Screen Heroes, you can expect some insights in the world of surfing cinema. Today we are in Hamburg, Germany, to check out Hamburg's annual Surf and Skate Festival. Then, we will be taking you to California where we will feature the San Diego Surf Film Festival. Let's go!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 2
programme.desc: Welcome to today's episode of Screen Heroes! We are in San Sebastian, not only one of Spain's most beautiful cities, but also home to one of the most important surfing festivals in the world. Then, we get transported to the African coastline with The African Project before returning to San Sebastian to discover what's inside the Teatro Principal.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - Kenya - Episode 5
programme.desc: In this episode, Andi arrives to the ancient Arabic town of Lamu. She is about to discover what dhow culture means to the people of Kenya. She spends three days with the incredible Ali Lamu, dhow builder and carpenter who is trying to save the lost art of dhow building. A unique experience will reveal many secrets of the location and this traditional work that is getting lost amongst younger people.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - South Africa - Episode 1
programme.desc: Welcome to Simon's Town, the neighbour port down here in Cape Town. Today on Ocean Safari we are meeting up with Roger Hudson and Asenathi Jim. This is the perfect representation of what the rainbow nation stands for. We will hear the story of these two individuals from completely different backgrounds join together to form a union and represent South Africa at the London Olympic Games. Let's find out more now on this first episode of Ocean Safari: South Africa!

programme.title: The South To Sian Journals
programme.desc: While filming South To Sian, a pair of adventurers dived into what began as a three-month trip and turned into a two-year odyssey of exploration.On boards, bikes, by boat and four-wheel drive, Harrison Roach and Zye Norris discovered if, in these days of GPS and WiFi, the dream of a true pioneering surf adventure is still alive.South to Sian Journals is a collection of stories documenting the people, places & adventures that occurred during the 2 years making “South To Sian” - the challenges, the surfers, riders, shapers, bike builders, filmmakers and photographers.Extremely entertaining and insightful, “Journals” documents the travels, the hardships, the spectacular locations, the personalities and the thoughts of the characters, both in front of and behind the lens.

programme.title: Second Life In Scandinavia
programme.desc: Hello from Sweden!We are on our way to the island of Orust. This island lives from boatbuilding, and big companies produce sailing boats here to expand their boats to the entire world. When the economic crisis stroke, demand decreased, thus less boats were ordered. This forced habitants of the small island of Orust to find a new path.Refit has become the new trend in Second Life in Scandinavia. Giving a new life to beautiful yachts, not only the economy is changing, but the local community as well. Lucia will venture into the island of Orust to learn more about the way its population has adapted and how it has become the mecca of boatbuilding.Watch out now, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - South Africa - Episode 2
programme.desc: South Africa is home to some of the world's most legendary surfers. In this episode, Andi goes to Cape Town to catch Jordy Smith before the next leg of the ASP Tour. In Durban Andi meets with Bianca Buitendag, to find out how winning 6 star ASP events has changed her life. Then she spends time with the legendary artisan behind the sport: Spider Murphey.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - South Africa - Episode 3
programme.desc: The Durban port is the biggest container port in the Southern Hemisphere. Enclosed in a bay, it is capable of admitting the largest vessels. As it is a compulsory Pilotage Port, controlling the port is intricate. Durban made history by announcing the first ever female marine pilots. Andi is in the Durban visiting Boni Mbambo, one of pioneers in the maritime industry.

programme.title: Maxiboat TV Show - Episode 7
programme.desc: In this new episode of Maxiboat we travel to the Cannes Yachting Festival 2021 for a special show. We jump on board the new Beneteau Gran Trawler 62, discover the Outremer 55 sailing catamaran, the new 2022 outboards and notably the incredible V12 from the American Mercury. Also at the Yachting Festival, we will dive into the most beautiful new motorboats and yachts of the show: Riva 68 Diable, Azimut Grande Trideck, Azimut 53, Azimut 68, the Swan Shadow and the Med Yacht 42.

programme.title: Maxiboat TV Show - Episode 8
programme.desc: In this episode 8 of Maxiboat, we dive into the world of ocean racing and the Ultimates category with these real F1 boats that distinguished themselves in the last Transat Jacques Vabre. Then we visit the Prestige Yachts in Vendée, France, to discover the X Line series and especially the brand new X60, a French motor-yacht in the era of time. Back to the Cannes Yachting Festival, we try out two brands in the spotlight: the Turkish shipyard Sirena Marine and its brand new Sirena 68 and then Zeelander, another high-end lobster brand from the Netherlands. Come on board with us!

Today we are in Hamburg, Germany, to check out Hamburg's annual Surf and Skate Festival. Then, we will be taking you to California where we will feature the San Diego Surf Film Festival. Let's go!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 2
programme.desc: Welcome to today's episode of Screen Heroes! We are in San Sebastian, not only one of Spain's most beautiful cities, but also home to one of the most important surfing festivals in the world. Then, we get transported to the African coastline with The African Project before returning to San Sebastian to discover what's inside the Teatro Principal.

programme.title: The Road To Bermuda - Episode 1
programme.desc: In this first episode of Road to Bermuda we meet the man who decided to take the America's Cup to Bermuda and explore some of sailing's most complex challenges. Also, the famous skipper Jimmy Spithill will share his experience on the island with us. Watch this and more on The Road to Bermuda!

programme.title: The Road To Bermuda - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this seasonal special, we’ll be catching up with SoftBank Team Japan and Oracle Team USA to find out exactly what they have on their Christmas wish lists this year. Rachel will also be cooking up a local holiday speciality and sampling it to the AC teams, as well as getting her dancing shoes on with the local Gombeys!

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep1 - Kayaking the Waitukubuli Sea Trail - Part One
programme.desc: Ken Whiting explores the Caribbean’s first and only sea kayaking trail – the Waitukubuli Sea Trail in Dominica.

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep2 - Kayaking the Waitukubuli Sea Trail - Part Two
programme.desc: Ken Whiting continues his exploration of the Caribbean’s first and only sea kayaking trail - the Waitukubuli Sea Trail in Dominica.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - South Africa - Episode 2
programme.desc: South Africa is home to some of the world's most legendary surfers. In this episode, Andi goes to Cape Town to catch Jordy Smith before the next leg of the ASP Tour. In Durban Andi meets with Bianca Buitendag, to find out how winning 6 star ASP events has changed her life. Then she spends time with the legendary artisan behind the sport: Spider Murphey.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - South Africa - Episode 3
programme.desc: The Durban port is the biggest container port in the Southern Hemisphere. Enclosed in a bay, it is capable of admitting the largest vessels. As it is a compulsory Pilotage Port, controlling the port is intricate. Durban made history by announcing the first ever female marine pilots. Andi is in the Durban visiting Boni Mbambo, one of pioneers in the maritime industry.

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 4
programme.desc: The World Sailing Show - Episode 4

programme.title: Vendée Arctique - Highlights
programme.desc: Skippers are getting ready for the 2022 edition of the Vendée Arctique: the solo race that surrounds Iceland before returning back to Les Sables d'Olonne. Jérémie Beyou became the winner of the 2020 edition of this arduous competition, but seeing the trajectory of Charlie Dalin and Thomas Ruyant, competition is closest than ever. Unpredictability in weather forecasts will force organizers to cut the race short, meaning skippers are running out of time to reduce distances.

programme.title: International Canoe Federation World Cup - Sprint 1 World Cup Szeged
programme.desc: The Sprint World Cup from the International Canoe Federation starts in Szeged, in the south of Hungary. This is the first Sprint World Cup of the 2018 season, and 700 athletes from 62 nations have been battling it out for the top spot. Who will raise to the top as the best nation in the sport? Find out on the highlights of the 2018 Sprint World Cup 1 Szeged.

programme.title: Julbo Sail Session
programme.desc: The mythical, legendary Cape Horn towers high in the imagination of all sailors. Located in the southern part of the Patagonia, sailors will travel from Usuaïa to Cap Horn. Passing it is always a feat so you can imagine the adventure two men set out for themselves when they dreamed of being the ﬁrst to pass it in a Nacra.Aboard a flying catamaran, the Julbo Session is a unique event that requires constant attention. The situation at the Julbo Sail season is tense and things become serious as the sailors have to push forward whatever happens, as the weather window is very brief and they have little time to succeed in their adventure.Embark on this journey across la Tierra del Fuego, a mystical place with extraordinary landscapes and incredible shifts in weather that allowed sailors in the Nacra to achieve a lifetime dream: pass Cape Horn aboard a flying catamaran.

programme.title: Surf The Alps - Breaking Ice
programme.desc: Host Lucia Metzbauer meets the crazy athletes who brave sup-zero temperatures pursuing their love of nautical sport. The frigid Austrian Alps prove to be rife with nautical sport as Lucia goes racing with ice sailors, meets the 5x world record holder of Ice diving, and discovers the little known sport of underwater Ice hockey!

programme.title: Azores European Windsurf Cup 2013
programme.desc: Formula Windsurfing Junior Youth & Masters European Championship - The Euro Cup 2013 was held in the stunning Azores archipelago. Be part of the race, meet the stars of the “Formula” world, get to know young aspiring talents and experience this exciting competition in this unique location in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean!

programme.title: Azores Windsurf Championship 2014

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 5
programme.desc: In this episode we’ll continue to follow the action of the 2018 KiteFoil World Series. We’ll reveal the new World Champions crowned in Cagliari, Italy at the final event of the series, the 2018 Sardinia Kiteboard Grand Slam.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 6
programme.desc: As kiteboarding becomes more popular and accessible to the masses, the hopes of many turn towards the Olympic Games. Although shaken, the spirit of the kiteboarders and their steadfast refusal to be defeated is rewarded with a vote of inclusion for the Youth Games in 2018 for the very first time. Yet again the Olympic dreams of the kiteboarders are on the line as the sport comes up for consideration for the Tokyo Games 2020.

programme.title: The Boat Show - Episode 1
programme.desc: Welcome to the sixth season of The Boat Show, the program dedicated to nautical advancements, sports and excitement. Today, we are on board the Pirelli 1, 100 Cabin before getting on board the new model of the Zar 95 Sport Luxury. Finally, we discover the center console from the Blackwater 39. Get comfortable and enjoy!

programme.title: The Boat Show - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this second episode of The Boat Show, we are ready to discover how Mercury Marine has invested over 800 million dollars to improve its own products by exploring the Mercury V8 300 Fourstroke. Then, we discover more about the ZF Company that specializes in transportation before getting on board the Hylas H48. Stay tuned!

programme.title: Up the Creek
programme.desc: There's only one boat race in the world where two-man teams blast up southern Australia's Murray River in aluminium dinghies at speeds of over 80kph. This river is not only known for dividing Victoria from New South Wales and for being Australia’s longest river, but also for being full of dangerous obstacles.Up the Creek challenges competing teams to speed up Murray River’s challenging water in a competition like no other. Find out now what will happen in this competition that explores Australia’s nature in depth, on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Jet RAID - Greece
programme.desc: We are in the city of Oropos for the first leg of the Jet Raid. In the coming days, we are going to cross over 1200km, visiting the islands of Milos, Kimolos, the city of Oropos and also Eretria, Kalkhida, and Nea Artaki amongst other islands. All the pilots will be rivals for the leaderboard, but we have separated them in different categories: Formula 1, F2 and F3. All of them driven in the world of jet skis and extreme sports.

Andi is in the Durban visiting Boni Mbambo, one of pioneers in the maritime industry.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 1
programme.desc: The 15th edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre is here! Injecting a fresh change, sailors are bound for Martinique and will explore for the first time the West Indies. Be part of the best moments of one of the most demanding transatlantic crossings that promises to be a sensational show as four different boat classes will be giving their all in unpredictable Atlantic waters.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 2
programme.desc: Sailors have already been in the water for a couple of days and tiredness is evident on their faces. Even if they compete in pairs, effort is constant and they have to be extremely tactical and careful with the strategic decisions they take on their route. Will Apivia win again in the extremely competitive IMOCA class? Let's find out what has happened this week in the 15th edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre.

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 3
programme.desc: On this episode, we are going to check out the Surf at Lisbon Film Fest in Portugal. Lisbon has a lot more to offer than just world-class waves, and we are ready to dive into the film action. Come join us as we visit this important surfing festival and take a close look behind the scenes!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 4
programme.desc: In today's episode of Screen Heroes we land in France. Before we check out the 10th edition of the International Surf Film Festival in Anglet we will be taking a closer look at this beautiful region. In the first win of the festival, Garrett Mcnamara's search for the world's biggest wave in Nazare has left us mesmerized. Will the rest of the movies cause the same impact?

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 9
programme.desc: Happy New Year! After all the events happening in 2020, we are all expecting incredible things happening in 2021. And what a better way to start the year but by being in the middle of the ocean, alone and fighting in one of the hardest sailing competitions ever seen? Competitors share with us what they wish in 2021 as they continue their journey in the Vendée Globe. Don't miss out!

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 10
programme.desc: Competitors have reached the South Atlantic and they enjoy the sunny weather of the summer in the Southern Hemisphere. But not everyone has gone this far. More than 5,000 nautical miles behind, a skipper is sailing across the Antipodes. Recovering the leaping distance will be tough, but can it be achieved? Find out what happens in this week's episode of the Vendée Globe on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Le Défi Azimut - Episode 1
programme.desc: One month before the Vendée Globe 2016, the best Imoca skippers were able to test their boat for the last time during the sixth edition of the Défi Azimut. Every year, this festive weekend provides an opportunity for all stakeholders in ocean sailing to see the Imoca 60 boats and to meet their skipper on the dock.

programme.title: The World Sailing Show - Episode 3
programme.desc: This month the World Sailing Show focuses on the thrills and spills of a decade of foiling with Sir Ben Ainslie at the INEOS TEAM UK training base in Cagliari, Italy. The British America’s Cup skipper looks ahead to an action-packed year in SailGP and the America’s Cup World Series. Then, we bring you action from the star-studded fleet competing in the RORC Caribbean 600 race - 700 sailors from 37 nations racing 600 miles around 11 islands. A year of Olympic sailing kicked off in Miami with the World Cup Series. We bring you the stories and action from the event that featured seven Olympic classes. Finally, Francis Joyon and his IDEC Sport crew concluded a winter of record-breaking by taking the Hong Kong to London tea clipper route record.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - South Africa - Episode 3
programme.desc: The Durban port is the biggest container port in the Southern Hemisphere. Enclosed in a bay, it is capable of admitting the largest vessels. As it is a compulsory Pilotage Port, controlling the port is intricate. Durban made history by announcing the first ever female marine pilots. Andi is in the Durban visiting Boni Mbambo, one of pioneers in the maritime industry.

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep1 - Kayaking the Waitukubuli Sea Trail - Part One
programme.desc: Ken Whiting explores the Caribbean’s first and only sea kayaking trail – the Waitukubuli Sea Trail in Dominica.

Yet again the Olympic dreams of the kiteboarders are on the line as the sport comes up for consideration for the Tokyo Games 2020.

Then, we go around the port to see whether if we can share this delicious platter with strangers. Then, we meet Chef Nikos to discover a special recipe he has for us.

programme.title: The Road To Bermuda - Episode 3

programme.title: Clipper: The Race Of Their Lives - Episode 3
programme.desc: Coming up in this week's episode, the crews are ready for an all Australian adventure as they sail coast to coast. After seeing the New Year in Tasmania, this is the final race of this leg, and they will be racing to the breath-taking Whitsunday islands.

programme.desc: The Sprint World Cup from the International Canoe Federation starts in Szeged, in the south of Hungary. This is the first Sprint World Cup of the 2018 season, and 700 athletes from 62 nations have been battling it out for the top spot. Who will raise to the top as the best nation in the sport? Find out on the highlights of the 2018 Sprint World Cup 1 Szeged.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 5
programme.desc: In this episode we’ll continue to follow the action of the 2018 KiteFoil World Series. We’ll reveal the new World Champions crowned in Cagliari, Italy at the final event of the series, the 2018 Sardinia Kiteboard Grand Slam.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 6
programme.desc: As kiteboarding becomes more popular and accessible to the masses, the hopes of many turn towards the Olympic Games. Although shaken, the spirit of the kiteboarders and their steadfast refusal to be defeated is rewarded with a vote of inclusion for the Youth Games in 2018 for the very first time. Yet again the Olympic dreams of the kiteboarders are on the line as the sport comes up for consideration for the Tokyo Games 2020.

programme.title: Rios Patagonicos
programme.desc: 15 canyoneers go on a life-changing expedition to discover the immensity of Chilean Patagonia in search for untouched territories, rivers and waterfalls organised by the Regard sur l’Aventure association. Their goal: to explore this mysterious land and spot and open over 30 canyons on a land where canyoneering is close to non-existent.For some, Rios Patagonicos is the opportunity to go on an expedition for the first time. For more skilled canyoneers, it is the occasion to share their experience on a tricky terrain. However, all of them will have to cooperate and share a common desire: the thrill of unveiling the unknown in a trip that awakes fear and team spirit.Awards:Finalist – Everest International Film Festival 2020. Finalist – The Taste Awards 2020. Finalist Best Sport Film – Flicks Film Festival 2019. Best Short Documentary – Panama International Film Festival 2019, Maracay International Film Festival 2019, Short Film Factory 2019. Semi-Finalist – New Harvest Film Festival 2019. Official Selections 2020: ATFF Costwolds, Trieste Int Mountain Film Festival, Naturetrack Film Festival, Mammoth Film Festival, Backpacklight Adventure Film Festival, Frozen River Film Festival, PIMFF etc. Official Selections 2019: Bansko, Explorimage, Festival du Film de Montagne, FICTS, Winter Film Festival, Rome Independent Prisma Awards, Sestriere Film Festival, Ember Aquatics Int Film Festival, Explos, Int Nature Film Festival Godollo, Les Escales Voyageuses, Rencontres du Film de Montagne, Adventure Shorts Film Festival, Big Water Film Festival, Action! Int Film Festival, Mountain & Adventure Film Festival, Vertical Life Film Festival, Veracruz Short Film Festival, Montevideo Int Film Festival, Inca Int Film Festival, BangkokThai Int Film Festival etc.

programme.title: World Rowing Coastal Championship - Episode 1
programme.desc: Competition has docked in Vancouver for the 2019 World Rowing Coastal Championship. An endurance test like no other, the event has buoy turns usually with a minimum distance of 4000m. With the stunning background of Vancouver Island, the World Champion of seven different boat classes will be crowned in this final.Watch the best moments of the 2019 competition of the World Rowing Coastal Championship.

programme.title: International Canoe Federation World Cup - Sprint 2 World Cup Duisburg
programme.desc: Welcome to Duisburg in Germany! The World Cup 2 of the 2018 season is being disputed, and athletes from all over the world are pitching themselves in one of the most beautiful settings we have on the circuit. Kayaks, canoes, singles, doubles and fours... all are fighting to go to the Olympic Games in Tokyo in two years time. Let's see where they are at the moment! Discover the best action of the weekend's regatta in Duisburg.

programme.title: International Canoe Federation World Cup - Sprint 3 World Cup Montemor
programme.desc: In this third stage of the competition we are in Montemor-o-Velho, in Portugal. This is the 2018 ICF Sprint World Championships, where 676 athletes from 66 nations are ready to give everything they have and raise with the title. The weather is perfect and the organization is perfect. Will the athletes be up to standards in this awaited event? Let's look back at the best of the action over the past four days of competition.

programme.title: Les Voiles De St Barth - Episode 1
programme.desc: Les Voiles de St. Barth is an excepartional event: a magnificent fleet of 70 boats, including some that are quite out of the ordinary; varied and challenging race courses; perfect weather conditions; suspense right to the last tack in the last race for many classes; and a roster of various shoreside events that were fun for the sailors as well as the local population.

programme.title: Surf The Alps - Munich
programme.desc: Munich, Germany, close to the Alps, but far away from the sea. In Munich, instead of waiting for vacations, surfers started experimenting on the 12m, 39ft wave in the Eisbach in the middle of the city 30 years ago.This way, river surfing was born. Nowadays, the wave is surfed day and night, during all seasons, attracting surf legends and tourists. But now the city wants to shut down the wave!

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 1
programme.desc: In this episode, we are in the TwinTip open Worlds in Hangloose beach, Italy where Florian Gruber has defended his title for the 3rd time! Then, we are set to join the Kite World Series in China’s Weifang and Pingtan where the fastest foilers are ready to set new records in kite foiling. We finish our journey at the final of the series that took place in Cagliari, Italy where Maxim Nocher has been crowned Champion of the series.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode we will focus on the action around the 2019 Kite Foil World Series, which is composed by four non-discard events. This means that all the event scores will be counted. The series began in Gizzeria, Italy and will head to China’s Pingtan and Weifang in September for two successive, action packed events before concluding in Cagliari, Italy. With the latter being the place where the male and female of 2019 Kite Foil World Champions will be crowned.

programme.title: The Boat Show - Episode 3
programme.desc: Welcome to Amsterdam, one of the most secure cities in the world at the heart of Europe. We are here to discover the Mets: the first European fair for sailing accessories. We will be exploring all the options at the Mets that has set a strong importance to research, and keywords here involve recycling, circular economy and strong environmental awareness.

programme.title: The Boat Show - Episode 4
programme.desc: In this episode we try out the Beneteau Swift Trawler 47, before getting aboard the ZL Elle 14, a boat created by Raffaele Zammarano that shows its own style. Then, we explore the brand Mylius that has evolved into a big shipyard and has great plans for the future. We interview Luciano Gandini, one of the owners of the company, to know a bit more about its history.

programme.title: International Canoe Federation World Cup - Sprint 2 World Cup Duisburg
programme.desc: Welcome to Duisburg in Germany! The World Cup 2 of the 2018 season is being disputed, and athletes from all over the world are pitching themselves in one of the most beautiful settings we have on the circuit. Kayaks, canoes, singles, doubles and fours... all are fighting to go to the Olympic Games in Tokyo in two years time. Let's see where they are at the moment! Discover the best action of the weekend's regatta in Duisburg.

programme.title: International Canoe Federation World Cup - Sprint 3 World Cup Montemor
programme.desc: In this third stage of the competition we are in Montemor-o-Velho, in Portugal. This is the 2018 ICF Sprint World Championships, where 676 athletes from 66 nations are ready to give everything they have and raise with the title. The weather is perfect and the organization is perfect. Will the athletes be up to standards in this awaited event? Let's look back at the best of the action over the past four days of competition.

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep3 - Great Family Adventure - Niagara Falls, Ontario
programme.desc: Pro kayakers Nick Troutman & Emily Jackson and family explore adventure-filled Niagara Falls, Canada.

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep4 - Great Family Adventure - Columbus, Georgia
programme.desc: Pro kayakers Nick Troutman & Emily Jackson and family explore Columbus, Georgia while in town for the USA Freestyle Kayaking Team Trials.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 1
programme.desc: In this episode, we are in the TwinTip open Worlds in Hangloose beach, Italy where Florian Gruber has defended his title for the 3rd time! Then, we are set to join the Kite World Series in China’s Weifang and Pingtan where the fastest foilers are ready to set new records in kite foiling. We finish our journey at the final of the series that took place in Cagliari, Italy where Maxim Nocher has been crowned Champion of the series.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode we will focus on the action around the 2019 Kite Foil World Series, which is composed by four non-discard events. This means that all the event scores will be counted. The series began in Gizzeria, Italy and will head to China’s Pingtan and Weifang in September for two successive, action packed events before concluding in Cagliari, Italy. With the latter being the place where the male and female of 2019 Kite Foil World Champions will be crowned.

programme.title: La Ruta de la Sal - Ruta de la Sal 2023
programme.desc: La Ruta de la Sal - Ruta de la Sal 2023

programme.title: Le Défi Azimut - Episode 1
programme.desc: One month before the Vendée Globe 2016, the best Imoca skippers were able to test their boat for the last time during the sixth edition of the Défi Azimut. Every year, this festive weekend provides an opportunity for all stakeholders in ocean sailing to see the Imoca 60 boats and to meet their skipper on the dock.

programme.title: Jet Ski World Series - Round 3 - USA
programme.desc: Jet Ski World Series - Round 3 - USA

programme.title: The Road To Bermuda - Episode 3
programme.desc: It's a new year, so what kind of resolutions have the America's Cup athletes made? And what's the local hangover cure for too much Bermudan rum? Find out in episode 3 of Road to Bermuda! We take look at the the regatta of 2015, before celebrating the start of the New Year with the local cocktail: dark ‘n’ stormies. Finally, we make sure we start the year in a good mood with the happiest man on the island, Johnny Barnes.

programme.title: The Road To Bermuda - Episode 4
programme.desc: The February episode is Valentine’s Day themed! We meet the new members of SoftBank Team Japan and find out what it takes to make it onto the team, as well as their thoughts on love. Then, we get an exclusive look at the site of the AC35 Event Village, and take the ultimate challenge – trying out for Bermuda’s Red Bull Youth America’s Cup team.

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 3
programme.desc: On this episode, we are going to check out the Surf at Lisbon Film Fest in Portugal. Lisbon has a lot more to offer than just world-class waves, and we are ready to dive into the film action. Come join us as we visit this important surfing festival and take a close look behind the scenes!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 4
programme.desc: In today's episode of Screen Heroes we land in France. Before we check out the 10th edition of the International Surf Film Festival in Anglet we will be taking a closer look at this beautiful region. In the first win of the festival, Garrett Mcnamara's search for the world's biggest wave in Nazare has left us mesmerized. Will the rest of the movies cause the same impact?

programme.title: Ocean Safari - South Africa - Episode 4
programme.desc: Andi van Zyl is back to Cape Town to meet up with two board riders. Tammy Robarts has just returned from the ISA World Surfing Games where she represented South Africa in stand up Paddleboarding. The winds in Cape Town have picked up and its time to meet with Luke Mc Gillewie, South Africa's top kite surfer.

programme.title: Ocean Safari - South Africa - Episode 5
programme.desc: Andi van Zyl is discovering and experiencing the coastline of South Africa through some of its remarkable personalities and their human spirit.

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Episode 5 Sharjah, UAE
programme.desc: The UIM ABP Aquabike World Championship has returned to the UAE for the traditional season-decider in Sharjah where the 2019 world championship will decide over three motos on Khalid Lagoon in all four categories: Ski Division GP1, Ski Ladies GP1, Freestyle and Runabout GP1. This is the fifth UIM ABP Grand Prix in Sharjah, and more than seventy riders from around the world will compete. In this program, we'll bring you all the Ski Mens and Ladies action.

programme.title: Jet RAID - Greece
programme.desc: Welcome to the 2019 edition of Jet Raid, the first step of a World Championship that is considered like the Dakar of the Sea. Specially prepared for these endurance races, the machines are divided in F1, F2, F3 and F4. The defending champion, Jean-Bruno Pastorello came in strong with his team. With the impressive lineup of the competition, will he be able to repeat last year's victory?

This is the fifth UIM ABP Grand Prix in Sharjah, and more than seventy riders from around the world will compete. In this program, we'll bring you all the Ski Mens and Ladies action.

programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre - Episode 3
programme.desc: The final moments of this year's edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre is almost here! All classes are making their way to Martinique, and the Ultimes after their 7,500 nm journey are eager to set land on foot. All classes have been extremely competitive and there is still no clear victor this season. What will the outcome be like? Let's find out on the third and final episode of the 15th Transat Jacques Vabre.

programme.title: The Cyclades With Andi Van Zyl - Ios
programme.desc: Andi van Zyl is in Ios Island at the time the Meltemi winds start, and she is ready to enjoy watersports both above and below the surface. Andi will understand the significance this island has on its habitants when she discovers what is believed to be the tomb of Homer: the creator of the Iliad and the Odyssey. This is our final stop in this journey around the Cyclades, so Andi is ready to make the most of it.

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 5
programme.desc: Today we are in Ericeira in Portugal, Europe's first surfing reserve and a magnet for tourists and surfers from all over the world. While we enjoy the Portuguese sun before heading over to the festival, we leave you a preview of the first film: Otelo Burning, a South African drama that yields a different perspective from professional surfing. Let's dive in!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 6
programme.desc: Welcome back to Screen Heroes, the show that travels the globe and visits the most important surfing festivals in the world! We are in London, and before we find out more about the British surf scene we are going to check out the capital. Are you ready to see what London has in stock for us?

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 11
programme.desc: Skippers have made their way up South America and are getting ready to push to the end in the Vendée Globe. Soon, they will cross the Equator and get back on the Northern Hemisphere, and that is good news for all. One of the boats had to return to his home port, so the lead of the Vendée Globe has changed.

programme.title: Vendée Globe Weekly Highlights - Episode 12
programme.desc: Finally. The last week of the Vendée Globe is here. Just five days from home, the Vendée Globe prepares the most unpredictable outcome in history. Three boats within 60 miles of each other, 3 sailors with hunger for victory and one destination: Sables d'Olonne. The final stretch promises to be thrilling and full of uncertainty.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode we will focus on the action around the 2019 Kite Foil World Series, which is composed by four non-discard events. This means that all the event scores will be counted. The series began in Gizzeria, Italy and will head to China’s Pingtan and Weifang in September for two successive, action packed events before concluding in Cagliari, Italy. With the latter being the place where the male and female of 2019 Kite Foil World Champions will be crowned.

programme.title: RKJ Sailing Legend
programme.desc: Born in Putney, London, Sir William Robert Patrick Knox-Johnston served in the Merchant Navy, where he acquired his skills to later on become a British legend and be awarded the title of Sir.RKJ Sailing Legend is a 56-minute documentary about possibly the most famous sailor in modern times, Sir Robin Knox-Johnston. RKJ was the first man to sail non-stop and alone around the world back in 1969: Now on the 50th anniversary of his achievement, we want to rememorate his feat.Get on board RKJ Sailing Legend, the remarkable story of Knox-Johnston's voyage around the world and into history. Available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep5 - Kayaking the Okefenokee National Wildlife Refuge
programme.desc: Ken Whiting explores the alligator-filled waters of the 438,000 acre Okefenokee swamp in Georgia.

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep6 - Great Family Adventure - West Virginia
programme.desc: Pro kayakers Nick Troutman & Emily Jackson and family set out on an adventure-filled road trip from Rock Island, Tennessee to West Virginia.

programme.title: Exploring Italy's Tyrrhenian Coasts - Episode 3
programme.desc: Exploring Italy's Tyrrhenian Coasts - Episode 3

programme.title: Exploring Italy's Tyrrhenian Coasts - Episode 4
programme.desc: Exploring Italy's Tyrrhenian Coasts - Episode 4

programme.title: Inside Superyachts - Episode 1
programme.desc: On this first episode of Inside Superyachts we meet with the Godfather of Superyacht builders – Feadship Yachts. Established in 1849, this Dutch shipyard is not only the number one in the industry but also the most famous of all superyacht builders, having created masterpieces for the likes of Steve Jobs.From the Netherlands we take a trip down to the ultra-discreet Principality of Monaco, host of the greatest yacht show in the world ‘The Monaco Yacht Show’. Then, we travel thousands of feet below the sea, exploring the vast ocean with Triton Submarines, utilized by some of films greatest names such as film director James Cameron and presenter David Attenborough.

programme.title: Inside Superyachts - Episode 2
programme.desc: From the Godfather of builders to the Grandaddy of designers we visit the studio of Bannenberg & Rowell to unveil the legend that is the late great Jon Bannenberg. Following the winds of change we discuss the growing demand for explorer yachts. We meet London based H2 Design, and learn about the groundbreaking 107m explorer M/Y Ulysses.We continue our theme with EYOS Explorer and DAMEN yachts, the largest and most prolific ship builder on the planet.

programme.title: Flavours Of The Sea - Episode 2
programme.desc: In today's episode, we are meeting Chef Dimitri who has a special surprise prepared for us. He will join us on our boat to prepare a unique fish soup, and we are ready to share this delicacy with the people in the port. We will also be meeting Chef Kostas who has his own recipe for pasta with tuna. Come on board and try it out!

programme.title: Flavours Of The Sea - Episode 3
programme.desc: Chef Nikolaos is giving us a well-needed cooking lesson before jumping on board to prepare the recipe he has in store for us. He will also take the time to teach us how to find out whether if a fish is fresh or not before we go on and try the dish with the people from the port. Then, we are meeting with the young Chef Jason, who with only 19 years is the main chef at a 4-star hotel. He is cooking on board our boat, and we are excited to try out his dish.

programme.title: Salon Nautique Paris - 2014
programme.desc: The annual event to discover the nautical novelties of the coming season. A showcase of close to 785 exhibitors and 1,300 brands for an attendance of over 240,000 visitors, 1200 boats on display including nearly 200 new features!

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Episode 5 Sharjah, UAE
programme.desc: The UIM ABP Aquabike World Championship has returned to the UAE for the traditional season-decider in Sharjah where the 2019 world championship will decide over three motos on Khalid Lagoon in all four categories: Ski Division GP1, Ski Ladies GP1, Freestyle and Runabout GP1. This is the fifth UIM ABP Grand Prix in Sharjah, and more than seventy riders from around the world will compete. In this program, we'll bring you all the Ski Mens and Ladies action.

programme.title: RKJ Sailing Legend
programme.desc: Born in Putney, London, Sir William Robert Patrick Knox-Johnston served in the Merchant Navy, where he acquired his skills to later on become a British legend and be awarded the title of Sir.RKJ Sailing Legend is a 56-minute documentary about possibly the most famous sailor in modern times, Sir Robin Knox-Johnston. RKJ was the first man to sail non-stop and alone around the world back in 1969: Now on the 50th anniversary of his achievement, we want to rememorate his feat.Get on board RKJ Sailing Legend, the remarkable story of Knox-Johnston's voyage around the world and into history. Available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Salon Nautique Paris - 2014
programme.desc: The annual event to discover the nautical novelties of the coming season. A showcase of close to 785 exhibitors and 1,300 brands for an attendance of over 240,000 visitors, 1200 boats on display including nearly 200 new features!

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep5 - Kayaking the Okefenokee National Wildlife Refuge
programme.desc: Ken Whiting explores the alligator-filled waters of the 438,000 acre Okefenokee swamp in Georgia.

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep6 - Great Family Adventure - West Virginia
programme.desc: Pro kayakers Nick Troutman & Emily Jackson and family set out on an adventure-filled road trip from Rock Island, Tennessee to West Virginia.

programme.title: Inside Superyachts - Episode 1
programme.desc: On this first episode of Inside Superyachts we meet with the Godfather of Superyacht builders – Feadship Yachts. Established in 1849, this Dutch shipyard is not only the number one in the industry but also the most famous of all superyacht builders, having created masterpieces for the likes of Steve Jobs.From the Netherlands we take a trip down to the ultra-discreet Principality of Monaco, host of the greatest yacht show in the world ‘The Monaco Yacht Show’. Then, we travel thousands of feet below the sea, exploring the vast ocean with Triton Submarines, utilized by some of films greatest names such as film director James Cameron and presenter David Attenborough.

programme.title: Inside Superyachts - Episode 2
programme.desc: From the Godfather of builders to the Grandaddy of designers we visit the studio of Bannenberg & Rowell to unveil the legend that is the late great Jon Bannenberg. Following the winds of change we discuss the growing demand for explorer yachts. We meet London based H2 Design, and learn about the groundbreaking 107m explorer M/Y Ulysses.We continue our theme with EYOS Explorer and DAMEN yachts, the largest and most prolific ship builder on the planet.

programme.title: The Road To Bermuda - Episode 3
programme.desc: It's a new year, so what kind of resolutions have the America's Cup athletes made? And what's the local hangover cure for too much Bermudan rum? Find out in episode 3 of Road to Bermuda! We take look at the the regatta of 2015, before celebrating the start of the New Year with the local cocktail: dark ‘n’ stormies. Finally, we make sure we start the year in a good mood with the happiest man on the island, Johnny Barnes.

programme.title: The Road To Bermuda - Episode 4
programme.desc: The February episode is Valentine’s Day themed! We meet the new members of SoftBank Team Japan and find out what it takes to make it onto the team, as well as their thoughts on love. Then, we get an exclusive look at the site of the AC35 Event Village, and take the ultimate challenge – trying out for Bermuda’s Red Bull Youth America’s Cup team.

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 5
programme.desc: Today we are in Ericeira in Portugal, Europe's first surfing reserve and a magnet for tourists and surfers from all over the world. While we enjoy the Portuguese sun before heading over to the festival, we leave you a preview of the first film: Otelo Burning, a South African drama that yields a different perspective from professional surfing. Let's dive in!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 6
programme.desc: Welcome back to Screen Heroes, the show that travels the globe and visits the most important surfing festivals in the world! We are in London, and before we find out more about the British surf scene we are going to check out the capital. Are you ready to see what London has in stock for us?

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 1
programme.desc: In this episode, we are in the TwinTip open Worlds in Hangloose beach, Italy where Florian Gruber has defended his title for the 3rd time! Then, we are set to join the Kite World Series in China’s Weifang and Pingtan where the fastest foilers are ready to set new records in kite foiling. We finish our journey at the final of the series that took place in Cagliari, Italy where Maxim Nocher has been crowned Champion of the series.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode we will focus on the action around the 2019 Kite Foil World Series, which is composed by four non-discard events. This means that all the event scores will be counted. The series began in Gizzeria, Italy and will head to China’s Pingtan and Weifang in September for two successive, action packed events before concluding in Cagliari, Italy. With the latter being the place where the male and female of 2019 Kite Foil World Champions will be crowned.

programme.title: The Road To Bermuda - Episode 5
programme.desc: In this episode of Road to Bermuda, we celebrate International Woman’s Day by uncovering some of the most inspirational and influential ladies in sailing to date. We have plenty of action from the M32 series, and we watch as some of our favourite AC sailors are taken hostage by the pirates of Bermuda, on board the Spirit of Bermuda. Also, we'll be following the Endeavour Programme to leave the sporting legacy in Bermuda and the island's status as the Shipwreck Capital of the World.

programme.title: The Road To Bermuda - Episode 6
programme.desc: In this episode we catch up on the results from the World Series in Oman, go on a sailing adventure on the Spirit of Bermuda and get a windsurfing lesson with Upwind Sports. We celebrate Good Friday Bermuda style, get VIP access to a new America’s Cup Exhibit, and catch up with the America’s Cup Endeavour Programme and the Red Bull Youth America’s Cup hopefuls!

programme.title: Clipper: The Race Of Their Lives - Episode 4
programme.desc: Today the Clipper Race crews are going to face up their biggest challenge in this epic circumnavigation of the planet: the Mighty Pacific Ocean. Its fearsome reputation is well deserved and it is not clear how everyone will cope. We meet two novice Mexican sailors who join for the ride of their lives; and a sailor testing her nerve, as the teams are pushed to their limits, facing hurricane force winds, monstruous waves and relentless freezing temperatures.

programme.title: The Cyclades With Andi Van Zyl - Naxos Part 1
programme.desc: Andi van Zyl has just arrived to the island of Naxos for the start of summer and the windy season. Naxos is a gem in the Aegean sea, where laughter, activity , sprwaling nature and beautiful beaches await. She is determined to explore the diversity of the island, from ancient greek ruins to modern watersports. Will she be able to handle the strong winds or will rough seas get the better of her?

programme.title: The Cyclades With Andi Van Zyl - Naxos Part 2
programme.desc: Over the past few days Andi has been travelling around Naxos, the largest of the Cyclades Islands in Greece. The Mediterranean waters look so inviting and so Andi cannot resist the opportunity to try a diving lesson on the island. We start our adventure at Blue Fin divers to get on the water. Dive into the second episode of The Cyclades with Andi Van Zyl, exclusive on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: International Canoe Federation World Cup - Slalom 1 World Cup Lee Valley
programme.desc: Welcome to the Lee Valley White Water Centre just outside London for the World Cup 1 of the ICF Canoe Slalom. We will be talking you through the action of this competition: it is going to be canoe single men followed by the kayak single women. Follow us for slalom competition at its highest level. Relive the best moments in Lee Valley 2019.

programme.title: International Canoe Federation World Cup - Slalom 2 World Cup Bratislava
programme.desc: Welcome to Bratislava, in Slovakia, for round two of the 2019 ICF Canoe Slalom World Cup. Mallory Franklin, Kimberley Woods and Jessica Fox were the top three in Lee Valley last weekend, however Mallory Franklin and Kimberley Woods will not be racing this weekend while Jessica Fox got eliminated in the semi-final. In the C1 men's the medalists from last weekend will also not be racing here, but there are some big names in the lineup. Let's dive into the action in Bratislava.

programme.title: The Kayak Man
programme.desc: Another expedition? You must be crazy.This is what Beppe's friend told him when he decided to leave for North America. Even after paddling in the biggest rivers in the world, his desire for adventure was still not satisfied, and he went out looking for more. Dreaming of freedom, sleeping bags and nature, he ventured into the unknown to discover the Yukon and Teslin Rivers.For those unaware, the Yukon river is the major watercourse of the northwest of North America. It flows through the Canadian Yukon Territory and makes it's way to Alaska. The Teslin River is a bit shorter, but not for this reason less fun to dive into. They both offer an impressive scenery amidst cold temperatures, dangerous whitewaters and the wild nature of North America.The Kayak Man takes us on a journey of self discovery through the most beautiful landscapes of Canada and the United States while following the path of a brave kayaker that leaves his life behind in an attempt to explore new horizons by himself. An impressive trip that will not leave him the same way he was before.

programme.title: Surf The Alps - Zurich Wakeboard
programme.desc: Despite being nestled in the heart of the Swiss Alps, Lake Zurich is home to a wealth of water sports. Journalist Lucia Metzbauer wakeboards with Swiss pros, attends the annual match race, and even tries stand-up paddleboarding before discovering a little-known sport: kanupolo.Also, the International Wakeboard Competition of Züri Fäscht 2013 is taking place in the centre of Zurich, and athletes are ready for Switzerland's greatest freestyle competition in this class. Let's dive into it!

programme.title: RKJ Sailing Legend
programme.desc: Born in Putney, London, Sir William Robert Patrick Knox-Johnston served in the Merchant Navy, where he acquired his skills to later on become a British legend and be awarded the title of Sir.RKJ Sailing Legend is a 56-minute documentary about possibly the most famous sailor in modern times, Sir Robin Knox-Johnston. RKJ was the first man to sail non-stop and alone around the world back in 1969: Now on the 50th anniversary of his achievement, we want to rememorate his feat.Get on board RKJ Sailing Legend, the remarkable story of Knox-Johnston's voyage around the world and into history. Available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 1
programme.desc: In this episode, we are in the TwinTip open Worlds in Hangloose beach, Italy where Florian Gruber has defended his title for the 3rd time! Then, we are set to join the Kite World Series in China’s Weifang and Pingtan where the fastest foilers are ready to set new records in kite foiling. We finish our journey at the final of the series that took place in Cagliari, Italy where Maxim Nocher has been crowned Champion of the series.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 2
programme.desc: In this episode we will focus on the action around the 2019 Kite Foil World Series, which is composed by four non-discard events. This means that all the event scores will be counted. The series began in Gizzeria, Italy and will head to China’s Pingtan and Weifang in September for two successive, action packed events before concluding in Cagliari, Italy. With the latter being the place where the male and female of 2019 Kite Foil World Champions will be crowned.

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 5
programme.desc: Today we are in Ericeira in Portugal, Europe's first surfing reserve and a magnet for tourists and surfers from all over the world. While we enjoy the Portuguese sun before heading over to the festival, we leave you a preview of the first film: Otelo Burning, a South African drama that yields a different perspective from professional surfing. Let's dive in!

programme.title: Screen Heroes - Episode 6
programme.desc: Welcome back to Screen Heroes, the show that travels the globe and visits the most important surfing festivals in the world! We are in London, and before we find out more about the British surf scene we are going to check out the capital. Are you ready to see what London has in stock for us?

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep5 - Kayaking the Okefenokee National Wildlife Refuge
programme.desc: Ken Whiting explores the alligator-filled waters of the 438,000 acre Okefenokee swamp in Georgia.

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep6 - Great Family Adventure - West Virginia
programme.desc: Pro kayakers Nick Troutman & Emily Jackson and family set out on an adventure-filled road trip from Rock Island, Tennessee to West Virginia.

programme.title: Salon Nautique Paris - 2014
programme.desc: The annual event to discover the nautical novelties of the coming season. A showcase of close to 785 exhibitors and 1,300 brands for an attendance of over 240,000 visitors, 1200 boats on display including nearly 200 new features!

programme.title: SSL Gold Cup - Ep.2- Highlight
programme.desc: SSL Gold Cup - Ep.2- Highlight

programme.title: H2O Racing: Aquabike World Championship - Episode 5 Sharjah, UAE
programme.desc: The UIM ABP Aquabike World Championship has returned to the UAE for the traditional season-decider in Sharjah where the 2019 world championship will decide over three motos on Khalid Lagoon in all four categories: Ski Division GP1, Ski Ladies GP1, Freestyle and Runabout GP1. This is the fifth UIM ABP Grand Prix in Sharjah, and more than seventy riders from around the world will compete. In this program, we'll bring you all the Ski Mens and Ladies action.

programme.title: RKJ Sailing Legend
programme.desc: Born in Putney, London, Sir William Robert Patrick Knox-Johnston served in the Merchant Navy, where he acquired his skills to later on become a British legend and be awarded the title of Sir.RKJ Sailing Legend is a 56-minute documentary about possibly the most famous sailor in modern times, Sir Robin Knox-Johnston. RKJ was the first man to sail non-stop and alone around the world back in 1969: Now on the 50th anniversary of his achievement, we want to rememorate his feat.Get on board RKJ Sailing Legend, the remarkable story of Knox-Johnston's voyage around the world and into history. Available on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: The Road To Bermuda - Episode 5
programme.desc: In this episode of Road to Bermuda, we celebrate International Woman’s Day by uncovering some of the most inspirational and influential ladies in sailing to date. We have plenty of action from the M32 series, and we watch as some of our favourite AC sailors are taken hostage by the pirates of Bermuda, on board the Spirit of Bermuda. Also, we'll be following the Endeavour Programme to leave the sporting legacy in Bermuda and the island's status as the Shipwreck Capital of the World.

programme.title: The Road To Bermuda - Episode 6
programme.desc: In this episode we catch up on the results from the World Series in Oman, go on a sailing adventure on the Spirit of Bermuda and get a windsurfing lesson with Upwind Sports. We celebrate Good Friday Bermuda style, get VIP access to a new America’s Cup Exhibit, and catch up with the America’s Cup Endeavour Programme and the Red Bull Youth America’s Cup hopefuls!

programme.title: Facing Waves - Ep5 - Kayaking the Okefenokee National Wildlife Refuge
programme.desc: Ken Whiting explores the alligator-filled waters of the 438,000 acre Okefenokee swamp in Georgia.

programme.desc: Pro kayakers Nick Troutman & Emily Jackson and family set out on an adventure-filled road trip from Rock Island, Tennessee to West Virginia.

programme.title: Inside Superyachts - Episode 1
programme.desc: On this first episode of Inside Superyachts we meet with the Godfather of Superyacht builders – Feadship Yachts. Established in 1849, this Dutch shipyard is not only the number one in the industry but also the most famous of all superyacht builders, having created masterpieces for the likes of Steve Jobs.From the Netherlands we take a trip down to the ultra-discreet Principality of Monaco, host of the greatest yacht show in the world ‘The Monaco Yacht Show’. Then, we travel thousands of feet below the sea, exploring the vast ocean with Triton Submarines, utilized by some of films greatest names such as film director James Cameron and presenter David Attenborough.

programme.title: Inside Superyachts - Episode 2
programme.desc: From the Godfather of builders to the Grandaddy of designers we visit the studio of Bannenberg & Rowell to unveil the legend that is the late great Jon Bannenberg. Following the winds of change we discuss the growing demand for explorer yachts. We meet London based H2 Design, and learn about the groundbreaking 107m explorer M/Y Ulysses.We continue our theme with EYOS Explorer and DAMEN yachts, the largest and most prolific ship builder on the planet.

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 3
programme.desc: In this episode, we are travelling to the other side of the world for the second act of the Kitefoil World Series to see if Toni Vodisek can keep up with his great performance beating and second fleet after Gizzeria. The 19-year-old Slovenian has secured his first regatta on the professional kite racing circuit. Will he beat the lead from Axel Mazella?

programme.title: Kite Masters - Episode 4
programme.desc: In this episode we are taking a domestic flight to the east coast of Fujian Province, Pingtan, for the Kitefoil World Series. The long sandy beaches and good weather conditions are placing Pingtan second most touristic island of China and if you combine its good winds, Pingtan makes perfect venue for Kiteboarding!

programme.title: The Boat Show - Episode 5
programme.desc: Welcome to The Boat Show, the best show in the world of boating for boat lovers and boating fans. Today we are on Lake Tellico, Tennessee, to try out the Mastercraft Xstar. Then, we move on to try the Island Packet 349, the American boat we've seen the most in Miami. Finally the Boat Show shows you one of the safest boats in the world, we are talking about the Ognitempo Classe 300. Find it out now!

programme.title: The Boat Show - Episode 6
programme.desc: In this new episode of The Boat Show we fall in love with the new Princess V60, a luxury boat from Princess. Then, we will see how ZF Marine products are used on professional workboats, where reliability and durability is even more important. ZF is a multinational technology company with headquarters in Germany, however we decided to sail on a ferry in Melbourne, Australia.

programme.title: Inside Superyachts - Episode 1
programme.desc: On this first episode of Inside Superyachts we meet with the Godfather of Superyacht builders – Feadship Yachts. Established in 1849, this Dutch shipyard is not only the number one in the industry but also the most famous of all superyacht builders, having created masterpieces for the likes of Steve Jobs.From the Netherlands we take a trip down to the ultra-discreet Principality of Monaco, host of the greatest yacht show in the world ‘The Monaco Yacht Show’. Then, we travel thousands of feet below the sea, exploring the vast ocean with Triton Submarines, utilized by some of films greatest names such as film director James Cameron and presenter David Attenborough.

programme.title: Inside Superyachts - Episode 2
programme.desc: From the Godfather of builders to the Grandaddy of designers we visit the studio of Bannenberg & Rowell to unveil the legend that is the late great Jon Bannenberg. Following the winds of change we discuss the growing demand for explorer yachts. We meet London based H2 Design, and learn about the groundbreaking 107m explorer M/Y Ulysses.We continue our theme with EYOS Explorer and DAMEN yachts, the largest and most prolific ship builder on the planet.

programme.desc: Welcome to Bratislava, in Slovakia, for round two of the 2019 ICF Canoe Slalom World Cup. programme.title: Transat Jacques Vabre 2021: Review
programme.desc: Welcome to the 15th edition of the Transat Jacques Vabre! Injecting a fresh change, sailors will be bound for Martinique as they explore for the first time the West Indies. The four participating classes have taken different routes: while the Class 40 sailed starboard in Cape Verde, the Imocas and Ocean Fifty's starboarded in Fernando de Noronha and the Ultimes in Trinidade and Martim Vaz. This edition has proven to be tougher than usual, and with several accidents taking place during the competition not all parting boats have made it to the Caribbean island. Watch the review of the Transat Jacques Vabre 2021 on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: PaddleSUP Mission Amazon
programme.desc: Charlie Head will attempt the first ever stand-up paddle boarding of the main water source of the Amazon, the Rio Marañón in Peru. It’s never been attempted before and will be the most arduous and longest SUP journey ever made.Two months of using just his physical and mental strength, Charlie will overcome extreme terrain, trek around impassable river rock falls, survive freezing waters, high altitude, swarms of insects and suspicious local tribes.However, all the hardships will be worth it if he can help shine some light on one of the planet’s most endangered environments and educates us on conservation as over 20 new dams are planned to be constructed on the river's free-flowing stretches. This could have, according to scientists, drastic consequences on the Amazon basin forever.If Charlie does not embark on this adventure now, he may never be able to do so. Find out more with Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Vendée Globe Review
programme.desc: To date, the VENDÉE GLOBE is the only solo sailing race around the world that is non-stop and without assistance. The event followed in the wake of the Golden Globe that initiated the first circumnavigation of this type via the three capes (Good Hope, Leeuwin and Horn) in 1968.44,996 kilometres, or 24,296 miles. That is the circumference of the Earth. The Vendée Globe accomplishes in 74 days this planetary voyage as participants sail down the Atlantic, across the Indian and face the challenges of the Pacific Ocean. The public refer to this arduous competition as the Everest of the seas, and this 9th edition will see 33 contenders depart from Les Sables-d’ Olonne to take part in a life changing competition.In this year's edition, sailors had to overcome storms, take advantage of high winds and competition has never been this close at the end as three skippers that are just 60 miles apart rush to cross the finish line first.Who ended up getting proclaimed the champion of one of the hardest sailing races in the world? Find it out on Nautical Channel.

programme.title: Max Havoc: Ring of Fire
programme.desc: Max Havoc is on a new assignment staying at a luxury hotel in the heart of a big city only to discover that the classy hotel owner is a vicious mob boss heading up a crime ring full of unwanted teenagers in the nearby slums.

programme.title: Double Cross
programme.desc: Kathy Swanson and her neighbor, Sheryl, are both having difficulty with their husbands. So when Sheryl suggests to Kathy that they should get their lives back by killing each other’s husbands, Kathy facetiously sanctions the plan.

programme.title: Universal Soldier III: Unfinished Business
programme.desc: Veronica and Luc conclude their quest to expose the Unisol program to the media and destroy Mentor's (Burt Reynolds) billion dollar heist, while the evil Dr. Walker creates a genetically engineered Unisol GR87, programmed with the single mission to destroy Luc and Veronica.

programme.title: San Saba
programme.desc: Private Investigator Bud wakes from a coma in a hospital room and is immediately charged with murder but did he do it or was he framed? As the story unfolds in flashback, Bud discovers that no one seems to be who he or she claim to be and everyone's motives are suspect.

programme.title: Universal Soldier II: Brothers in Arms
programme.desc: Luc and Veronica recover and revive Luc's long-lost brother who has been suspended in a cryo-chamber for decades and attempt to expose the Unisol program, led by Mazur (Gary Busey), which recycles dead soldiers in the attempt to create the ultimate mercenary army.

programme.title: Max Havoc: Ring of Fire
programme.desc: Max Havoc is on a new assignment staying at a luxury hotel in the heart of a big city only to discover that the classy hotel owner is a vicious mob boss heading up a crime ring full of unwanted teenagers in the nearby slums.

programme.title: Last Chance Cafe
programme.desc: After uncovering evidence that her stepfather was murdered by a ring of corrupt cops and judges, including her DA ex-husband, a woman is forced to flee with her daughter and hide in a small farming town, where she falls for a local ranch owner but danger soon follows.

programme.title: Max Havoc: Curse of the Dragon
programme.desc: Exotic action/adventure and martial arts blend together as Max Havoc, world famous kickboxer turned sports photographer, faces the relentless Black Dragons in a reluctant quest to save the lovely Goody sisters and to avenge the death of good friend Tahsi in Guam.

programme.title: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Devon thought that his share of difficulties were over after a difficult divorce but on the road to rebuilding his life, tragedy strikes leaving him in a fight for his freedom and his innocence.

programme.title: Double Cross
programme.desc: Kathy Swanson and her neighbor, Sheryl, are both having difficulty with their husbands. So when Sheryl suggests to Kathy that they should get their lives back by killing each other’s husbands, Kathy facetiously sanctions the plan.

programme.title: Captive Hearts
programme.desc: A finance executive is mysteriously kidnapped and when the hostage takers send video demands directly to the man’s wife, a lone police officer, Detective Kelsoe, has his suspicions.

programme.title: 12 Hours to Live
programme.desc: 18 year old Amy is kidnapped by a deranged gunman wanted for the murder of an FBI Agent and FBI Agent Megan is hot on his trail. When it's learned that Amy is a type-1 diabetic, Megan must once again confront the man who violently killed her partner to save Amy.

programme.title: Polo Rider Cup Competition - Deauville International Polo Club vs Empire Club of Coachella Valley
programme.desc: Deauville International Polo Club is going against Empire Club of Coachella Valley in this first stage of the 2021 Polo Rider Cup at the Polo Club of Chantilly. Both teams have been preparing hard for this moment and are ready to make the most points to advance to the next stage. Who will win?
